bios: ["Gao Yunfeng chairs Han's Laser Technology Industry Group, a supplier of laser-based products for industrial applications. ", "Han's Laser Technology was founded by Gao in 1996.", 'Gao holds an undergraduate degree in aircraft design from Beihang University and an MBA from Peking University.']
person.name: Gao Yunfeng

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Liang Zhaoxian is president of Galanz Group, one of China's largest suppliers of microwave ovens, air conditioners and household appliances.\r\n", 'The company traces its roots to 1978 when it was founded as a feather product plant.']
person.name: Liang Zhaoxian

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Konstyantin Zhevago is CEO of Ukranian mining company Ferrexpo, which is listed on the London Stock Exchange; he owns a stake of just over 50%.', 'He became finance director of the bank Finance & Credit in 1992, eventually buying the business, which went bankrupt in 2015.', 'He took over the precursor to Ferrexpo, Poltava Iron Ore, in 1996 and took it public in 2007. ']
abouts: ['Zhevago is an avid soccer fan and owns the FC Vorskla team.', "Zhevago has been a member of Ukraine's parliament since 1998."]
person.name: Kostyantin Zhevago

bios: ['Daniel Feffer is one of 4 billionaire brothers who control of Suzano Papel e Celulose, a Brazilian paper firm founded in 1924 by their grandfather.', 'The second-eldest of the brothers, he is vice-chairman of Suzano, which in early 2019 acquired Brazilian pulp and paper firm Fibria Celulose.', 'An advocate of open markets, Daniel Feffer is the President of the Brazilian branch of the International Chamber of Commerce.\r\n', 'He also founded Intelligent Tech & Trade Initiative, a think tank that aims to inform and influence foreign trade professionals. \r\n']
person.name: Daniel Feffer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Anu Aga derives her wealth from a 62% stake in listed engineering firm Thermax.', 'Aga started working at Thermax in 1985 when it was run by her husband and took the helm in 1996 after he died of a heart attack. ', 'She stepped down as chairman in 2004, ceding the spot to her daughter Meher, a UK-trained chemical engineer who lets hired executives manage the firm.']
abouts: ['Aga cofounded Teach for India in 2008, a non-profit that recruits young people to teach for 2 years in schools for low-income kids. ', 'Aga is a nominated member of parliament.']
person.name: Anu Aga

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Chris Sacca made early bets investing in Twitter and Uber through his venture capital firm Lowercase Capital.', 'Sacca also invested in Twilio, a cloud software company, which went public in 2016.', 'In April 2017, Sacca announced he was retiring from venture capital to launch a podcast, act on TV shows and raise his young children.', 'Sacca also proclaimed himself an active opponent of the Trump administration.']
abouts: ['He is known for wearing cowboy shirts - a sharp detour from the Silicon Valley tech investor uniform. ', 'He had a regular gig on the business pitch show Shark Tank; he stopped his appearances when he retired.']
person.name: Chris Sacca

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Canberra native Terry Snow is the executive chairman of Capital Airport Group, which operates Canberra Airport.', "He became a billionaire in 2017, thanks to a bumper increase in the value of his property around the capital city's main airport.", "He's invested more than $2 billion developing the airport and building office and industrial parks on the 1,062 acres of surrounding land.", 'Snow trained as an accountant but worked as a property developer in the 1980s with his father, Bob, and brother George. ', 'After the family business was sold he used his share of the proceeds to buy the 99-year lease on the airport, paying just $40 million in 1998. ']
abouts: ['Snow is a major philanthropist, keen yachtsman and the owner of a new A$100 million equestrian center, Willinga Park.  ']
person.name: Terry Snow

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Jorge Gallardo Ballart's father founded pharmaceutical company Almirall in 1943 in Barcelona.", 'After their father died in 1988, Jorge and his brother Antonio took over running Almirall.', 'Jorge is executive president of Almirall, which had about $875 million revenues in 2017.', 'In August 2018, Almirall announced the acquisition of five products from the dermatology division of Allergan.']
person.name: Jorge Gallardo Ballart

bios: ["Ed Stack is the CEO and largest individual shareholder of Dick's Sporting Goods. ", 'His father, Dick Stack, founded the retailer in 1948 with a $300 loan from his grandmother. ', 'Ed and his siblings bought the company from his father when it only had two stores in upstate New York.', 'When his father retired in 1984, Ed took over as CEO and chairman.', "He took the company public in 2002. Dick's Sporting Goods had $8.5 billion in revenue in 2018 and 750 locations around the U.S."]
abouts: ["In 2019, Stack announced that Dick's Sporting Goods has eliminated the hunting category, including firearms, from 125 stores. "]
person.name: Edward Stack

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Bolivian-born Miguel Krigsner founded Grupo Boticario, Brazil's second-largest cosmetics company behind number one, Natura. ", 'Grupo Boticario operates in cities around Brazil and seven other countries. Krigsner owns nearly 80% of the $1.15 billion (revenues) firm. ', 'His brother-in-law Artur Grynbaum joined as a financial assistant and worked his way up to CEO of the group. He owns about 20% of the group. ', "In 1990 Krigsner create Foundation Boticario de Protecao a Natureza, which receives about 1% of Grupo Boticario's net income annually."]
abouts: ['His parents fled Nazi Germany to settle in Bolivia in the 1940s. Krigsner was born in Bolivia and moved to Brazil in 1961.']
person.name: Miguel Krigsner

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Bruce Nordstrom and his sister, Anne Gittinger, are the largest individual shareholders of fashion retailer Nordstrom Inc. ', 'The department store chain was founded by their grandfather as a shoe store in 1901.', 'Nordstrom became president of the family company in 1963 and retired as chairman of the board in 2006.', 'During his tenure as chairman, revenues grew from $40 million to $8 billion.', 'Nordstrom Inc. now operates more than 300 stores across the US, Canada and Puerto Rico.']
abouts: ['Bruce Nordstrom started working at age 9 in the stockroom and on the sales floor of a Nordstrom store.', 'His sons, Peter and Erik now serve as co-presidents of the clothing chain.']
person.name: Bruce Nordstrom

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Former hippie Richard Hayne opened his first apparel shop with his ex-wife in the mid-70s near the University of Pennsylvania with only $4,000. ', 'Today, Urban Outfitters is a nationwide chain with more than 200 locations and over $3.9 billion in revenue.', 'Hayne took Urban Outfitters public in 1993 and owns nearly a quarter of the company with his wife.', "Hayne became the company's CEO in 2012 after former CEO Glen Senk left to run New York-based jeweler and watchmaker David Yurman. ", 'His firm has been at the center of controversy over the years when its products have offended the LGBT community, Navajos, Irish Americans and Jews. ']
abouts: ['Hayne also owns the 700-acre Doe Run Dairy farm in Pennsylvania, which produces cheese.', 'In 1969, after graduating with a degree in anthropology from Lehigh University, Hayne did a stint volunteering with Eskimos in Alaska.\r\n']
person.name: Richard Hayne

financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '002568-CN', 'companyName': 'Shanghai Bairun Flavor & Fragrance Co.,Ltd.', 'numberOfShares': 217137000, 'sharePrice': 3.771336692651133, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}, {'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '002568-CN', 'companyName': 'Shanghai Bairun Flavor & Fragrance Co.,Ltd.', 'numberOfShares': -54635000, 'sharePrice': 3.771336692651133, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Liu Xiaodong chairs Shanghai Bairun Investment Holding Group, a maker of alcopop beverages.', 'Liu worked at tobacco and flavorings companies before cofounding the predecessor of Shanghai Bairun in 1997.\r\n']
person.name: Liu Xiaodong

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Yusuf Hamied is the non-executive chairman of $2.1 billion (revenue) generics maker Cipla.', 'Cipla was founded in 1935 by his father Khwaja Abdul Hamied, a disciple of Mahatma Gandhi.', 'After the patriarch passed away in 1972, Cambridge-educated Hamied and his brother Mustafa inherited the business.', 'Hamied took on big pharmaceutical companies, offering low-cost generic drugs for diseases such as AIDS, earning the label of drug pirate. \r\n']
abouts: ["His niece Samina Vaziralli is now Cipla's executive vice chairman.", "Renowned music conductor Zubin Mehta is Hamied's childhood pal."]
person.name: Yusuf Hamied

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Ion Tiriac owns a minority stake in Romanian insurance company Allianz-Tiriac.', 'The tycoon has also invested in real estate, auto dealerships and petroleum distribution.', 'His museum in Romania showcases his high-end cars, including Jaguars, Rolls Royces and Ferraris.']
abouts: ['Tiriac competed in the 1960 Olympics as an ice hockey player.', 'A former tennis player, Tiriac has managed Boris Becker, Steffi Graf and Goran Ivanisevic and owns the Madrid Open.', 'Tiriac is reportedly spending $4 million to construct an Olympic ice rink near Bucharest.']
person.name: Ion Tiriac

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Kim Jung-woong is the founder and chief executive of GP Club, a Seoul-based cosmetics firm. ', 'His company is best known for its line of JM Solution facial masks, which are a mega hit in mainland China. ', 'In just two years since their launch, GP Club had sold more than one billion masks, ballooning sales by more than 900% and profits by 3,000% in 2018.', 'In October 2018, Goldman Sachs invested 75 billion won ($67 million) for a 5% stake in the company. ', 'With his wife and child, Kim holds just under 95% of the privately-held outfit. ']
abouts: ['Kim started his entrepreneurial journey selling video games and consoles from a small Seoul apartment. ', 'After losing his father at age 15, Kim says he was driven by the need to make money early on. ']
person.name: Kim Jung-woong

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Eiichi Kuriwada's father, Kiyoshi Sagawa, founded a package delivery firm in 1957; now called Sagawa Express, it's Japan's No. 2 delivery outfit.", 'Sagawa Express parent SG Holdings listed its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in December 2017.', 'Kuriwada stepped down as president of SG Holdings in 2015 but remains chairman.', 'In the early 1990s, Sagawa Express was the focus of a scandal; an executive was convicted of paying off politicians.', 'Sagawa, a billionaire in 1992, resigned that year; neither he nor Kuriwada were charged as part of the scandal. ']
person.name: Eiichi Kuriwada

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Cui Lijie owns the majority of Imperial Pacific International Holdings.', 'The company has been granted an exclusive casino license for Saipan in the Commonwealth of Northern Marianas Islands, a U.S. Pacific territory. ', 'Imperial Pacific ran a temporary casino in a local shopping mall until the gaming section of its $600 million beachfront hotel opened in July 2017.', "Cui's son Ji Xiaobo, formerly an executive with Macau junket promoter Hengsheng Group, has been dubbed 'mastermind' of the Saipan project. ", "Cui has been majority owner of Imperial Pacific since its 2013 listing but only joined the company's board of directors in May 2017."]
abouts: ["In addition to its hotel, Imperial Pacific has proposed developing a multibillion casino district similar to Macau's Cotai Strip.", 'Cui worked as a so-called barefoot doctor in mainland China. ', 'Prior to Imperial Pacific, Cui was a real estate investor and jewelry collector.']
person.name: Cui Lijie

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Nikita Mishin and partners Konstantin Nikolaev and Andrei Filatov own roughly one third of Globaltrans, Russia's biggest private rail operator.", 'In December of 2017 the partners sold their  stakes in Global Ports, exiting the port business.', 'He and his partners worked together at a railroad freight company.']
abouts: ['Mishin is the founder of charity fund Dar, which helps talented children, including ones from low-income families.']
person.name: Nikita Mishin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Konstantin Nikolaev and his partners Nikita Mishin andAndrei Filatov own a third of Globaltrans, Russia's biggest private rail transport operator.", "Konstantin Nikolaev and his partners Nikita Mishin and Andrei Filatov own a third of Globaltrans, Russia's biggest private rail transport operator.", 'The trio sold their stakes in Global Ports, exiting the port business in December 2017. ', 'He and his partners worked together at Petra, a railroad freight company.']
abouts: ['Nikolaev is one of the co-founders of Moscow management school Skolkovo, the first business school in Russia.', "In 1996 the partners agreed with one of Petra's clients, Alexei Mordashov's Severstal, to start a transport company. They later bought him out."]
person.name: Konstantin Nikolaev

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['In 1960, Jose Llado Fernandez-Urrutia founded Tecnicas Reunidas, a construction company he built into a multibillion-dollar business.', 'He chairs the Madrid-listed company, which has projects ranging from refineries in Turkey and Russia to a seawater desalination plant in Australia.', "He served in Spain's government in the 1970s and as the country's ambassador to the United States from 1978 to 1982.", "He's also an art connoisseur, serving as a patron to Spain's Fundacion de Amigos del Museo del Prado since 1983 and Museo Reina Sofa since 2013."]
abouts: ['He holds a doctorate from University of Madrid in chemistry and industrial chemistry.']
person.name: Jose Llado Fernandez-Urrutia

financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '002304-CN', 'companyName': 'Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery Joint-Stock Co Ltd', 'numberOfShares': 54492000, 'sharePrice': 15.863445167032745, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Zhang Yubai chairs rice wine supplier Yanghe Group.', 'He was formally general manager and vice chairman of A-share listed Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery Joint-stock.']
person.name: Zhang Yubai

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'MEXICO', 'ticker': 'TLEVISACPO-MX', 'companyName': 'Grupo Televisa S.A.B Unit Class A (TLEVISACPO-MX)', 'numberOfShares': 425270000, 'sharePrice': 2.3496081338699426, 'currencyCode': 'MXN', 'exchangeRate': 18.884, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ["Emilio Azcrraga Jean inherited control of Mexico's largest television company, Televisa, after his father, Emilio Azcarraga Milmo, died in 1997.", 'Televisa was founded by his grandfather, Emilio Azcrraga Vidaurrieta.', "After two decades at the helm, Azcrraga decided to step down as Televisa's CEO at the beginning of 2018, but retains his role as chairman."]
person.name: Emilio Azcarraga Jean

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Dirk Stroeer is the son of Heinz W. Stroeer, who laid the foundation for Stroeer SE & Co. KGaA setting up billboards in Germany back in 1963.\r\n', "In 1990 Heinz joined forces with competitor Udo Mueller, now CEO of Stroeer SE, to create one of Germany's biggest out-of-home media providers.", " It went public in 2010. Dirk inherited a 50% stake from his father and is still the company's biggest shareholder, with more than 20%.", 'Headquartered in Cologne, Stroeer SE employs more than 4,500 people and generates annual revenue of over $1 billion.', "Dirk Stroeer is a member of the company's supervisory board."]
abouts: ['Stroeer is a managing partner at Media Ventures GmbH, a private venture capital company in Cologne.']
person.name: Dirk Stroeer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Markus Blocher is a billionaire thanks to two Swiss chemical companies, EMS-Chemie and Dottikon ES Holding.', 'Blocher got his start working at EMS-Chemie, the Swiss polymer and chemical manufacturer that his family has run for decades.', 'He received a stake in the firm when his father, Christoph Blocher, sold his shares to his children to take a seat on the Swiss federal council.', 'Markus eventually sold his shares in EMS-Chemie and took over Dottikon, its spinoff.']
person.name: Markus Blocher

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Cho Jung-ho is the chairman of Meritz Financial Group. ', 'He is the youngest of the four sons of Cho Choong-hoon, the late founder of Hanjin Group, the parent company of Korean Air.  ', 'He worked for Korean Airlines in Europe and returned home in 1989 as a director with Hanjin Investment & Securities, as Meritz was then named. ']
abouts: ["Cho's father started out with a single truck and went on to build an empire based mostly on transportation. ", "He has outstripped his brothers in wealth and success; Meritz's value has multiplied since it broke away from the Hanjin Group in 2005. "]
person.name: Cho Jung-ho

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Ben Silbermann is the CEO of the photo bookmarking site Pinterest, which went public in April 2019.', 'Silbermann, along with cofounders Evan Sharp and Paul Sciarra, launched the first desktop version of Pinterest in March 2010.  ', 'Pinterest lets users save and share image collections from recipes to hairstyles to crafts and home decor through their mobile phones or computers. \r\n']
abouts: ['Ben Silbermann grew up in Iowa and collected dried insects which he then would pin on cardboard. \r\n', 'After graduating from Yale, Silbermann spent three years as a consultant. He joined Google in 2006 but quit to focus on his startup, Cold Brew Labs. ']
person.name: Ben Silbermann

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Paul Fireman bought the US distribution rights for a British company in 1979, turned it into Reebok and rode the sneakers & aerobics craze in the 80s.', 'Nike pulled ahead in the early 1990s, and shareholders demanded that Fireman step down in 1996, which he eventually did.', 'Fireman returned in 1999 and revived the business before selling it to Adidas for $3.8 billion in 2005, a deal that earned him $600 million.', 'He now chairs Fireman Capital Partners out of Boston, founded by his son Dan in 2008.', 'Fireman owns Liberty National Golf Course, a $250 million country club built on a New Jersey landfill overlooking the Statue of Liberty.']
abouts: ['Liberty National Golf club is one of the most exclusive courses in the world, with members reportedly paying $500,000 to join.', 'Before creating Reebok, Fireman was an officer in an outdoor sports distributorship.']
person.name: Paul Fireman

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Daniel Lubetzky is founder and majority owner of snack bar company Kind Healthy Snacks.', "Founded in 2004, Kind's most popular items are its bars with whole nuts, which come in 24 flavors. The company has sold 2 billion bars to date", 'Mars, the candy conglomerate behind M&Ms and Snickers, bought an estimated 40% stake in Kind in 2017 for an undisclosed amount.', 'Prior to Kind, Lubetzky started PeaceWorks, a marketing, consulting and distribution company, in 1994.\r\n', 'PeaceWorks specialized in selling items produced by groups in conflict, such as chocolates from Arabs and Israelis.', 'While traveling for PeaceWorks, Lubetzky found a bar with whole nuts and fruit in Australia which became the impetus for Kind. ']
abouts: ['While in high school and college, Lubetzky purchased watches wholesale and sold them at a markup at flea markets and shopping mall kiosks. \r\n', 'Lubetzky wrote a 268-page senior thesis at Trinity University about achieving peace between Arabs and Israelis through business ventures.']
person.name: Daniel Lubetzky

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios:
['Vadim Yakunin founded Protek Center of Implementation in 1990.', 'Protek, which went public in 2010 and now has $4 billion in revenues, is one of the biggest drug distributors in Russia.
', 'Yakunin, who got his start importing computers and writing software, also worked in the tourist business in Hungary.', 'While in Hungary, he met reps from a large pharmaceutical firm and decided to start importing drugs. ', 'Later he founded the Rigla chain of drug stores, and built a pharmaceutical factory and logistics center near Moscow.']
abouts: ["Sister Yuliya Yakunina is economic director of Protek and a member of Protek's board since 2002.", 'Yakunin graduated from the Moscow Physical and Technical Institute (MIPT) as engineer-physicist. He holds a degree as a Doctor of Technical Sciences.\r\n']
person.name: Vadim Yakunin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'SAO PAULO', 'ticker': 'SUZB3-BR', 'companyName': 'Suzano Papel e Celulose S/A', 'numberOfShares': 112456000, 'sharePrice': 9.86402167698312, 'currencyCode': 'BRL', 'exchangeRate': 4.0227, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Ruben Feffer is one of four billionaire brothers who control Suzano Papel e Celulose, a Brazilian paper giant founded by their grandfather.', 'Known as Binho, he is the only brother who is not a board member of Suzano. \r\n', 'Ruben, a pianist, is credited with the music for Boy and the World, a 2013 Brazilian film nominated for Academy Award for best animated feature.', 'He has developed a career creating music for movies and TV shows via his company Unisson Productions.']
person.name: Ruben Feffer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Kagemasa Kozuki is the founder and chairman of video game developer Konami Holdings.', 'The Tokyo-listed company has had success with free-to-play smartphone soccer games.', 'His company also produces gaming machines for casinos in the U.S. and elsewhere.', 'His son Takuya is the president and representative director of Konami Holdings.']
abouts: ['Kozuki got his start repairing jukeboxes and cathode ray tube televisions.']
person.name: Kagemasa Kozuki

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Veteran investment banker Hemendra Kothari chairs DSP Investment Managers, which has $5.5 billion in assets under management. ', "He founded the firm in 2008 in partnership with BlackRock but bought out BlackRock's stake ten years later.", 'Kothari started his career with family firm D.S. Purbhoodas & Co before founding financial services firm DSP Financial Consultants in 1975. ', 'He partnered with Merrill Lynch in 1995 but sold his 57% stake in tranches between 2005 and 2009.']
abouts: ['A wildlife enthusiast, he founded the Wildlife Conservation Trust and has named meeting rooms at his office after tiger reserves.', 'His great-grandfather was one of the founders of the Bombay Stock Exchange.\r\n']
person.name: Hemendra Kothari

name: Real-Time Billionaires

bios: ['Jorge Feffer is one of four billionaire brothers who control Suzano Papel e Celulose, a Brazilian paper giant founded by their grandfather.\r\n', 'In January 2019, Suzano completed a roughly $9 billion cash and stock acquisition of Brazilian pulp and paper maker Fibria.', 'He was the Deputy Chief Corporate Officer of Suzano from 2013 until 2015 and currently serves as a board member. ', 'Jorge partnered with a Brazilian publisher on a book series known as Library of Social Critics, with works by authors like philosopher Leo Strauss.']
person.name: Jorge Feffer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Fuat Tosyali is CEO of steel and iron producer Tosyali Holding, which has 18 facilities spread over Turkey, Serbia and Algeria.', 'At age five, he began working with his father in a small workshop in Iskenderun, where they made sheet metal out of used tin cheese cans.', 'From sheet metal, they went on to bucket and stove production. The family began investing in Algeria in 2008.', "Including overseas operations, Tosyali is on track to become Turkey's largest iron and steel producer, with an 8.5 million ton capacity by 2019.", 'Fuat shares ownership in the business with younger brothers Ayhan and Fatih Tosyali, who are also billionaires.']
abouts: ['By the end of 2019, Tosyali Holding expects to have invested in excess of $6 billion in integrated production facilities located in Oran, Algeria.', 'Fuat Tosyali flies on his private jet to visit operations in Algeria every week.']
person.name: Fuat Tosyali

bios: ['Robert Friedland founded and chairs Toronto-listed Ivanhoe Mines, a leader in the mining and precious metals industry.', 'Based in Singapore, Friedland is praised for finding profitable mines in remote areas like Oyu Tolgoi in Mongolia.', 'A graduate of Reed College, Friedland also funds Ivanhoe Capital Corporation, which invests in emerging markets.', 'He has a 12.7% stake in Australia-listed CleanTeQ Holdings, which supplies cobalt and nickel to lithium-ion battery producers.', 'His Canada-based Peregrine Diamonds, was acquired in September 2018 by De Beers Group for around $80 million.']
abouts: ["Friedland's son Govind is a geologist and founder of uranium mining outfit GoviEx Uranium.\r\n", 'Friedland owns Ivanhoe Pictures, a production company that merged with Sidney Kimmel Entertainment to form SK Global.']
person.name: Robert Friedland

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Madeleine Olsson-Eriksson is a part owner of Stena Sphere, a privately held Swedish conglomerate. ', 'Interests include cruising, shipping, offshore drilling, property and metal recycling.', "Madeleine's father, Sten, founded Stena in 1939 as a trading company.", 'Her brother Dan took over in 1983 and now owns 51% of the company. Madeleine and her brother Stefan Olsson own 12.5% and 24.5%, respectively.', "Madeleine's children, Gustav and Marie, each own 6%  and have seats on different boards in the company."]
abouts: ['She became the first of her family to go to college, earning a degree in medicine and pursuing a career as a gynecologist.', 'Aside from an 12.5% stake in Stena, she is also part owner of a clinic in Gothenburg.']
person.name: Madeleine Olsson Ericksson

bios: ['Zheng Yuewen is cofounder and chairman of Creat Group, whose interests include agribusiness, finance, natural resources and pharmaceuticals.', 'Zheng, a former railway ministry worker, made his early money in real estate in Nanchang after leaving the government.']
person.name: Zheng Yuewen & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: [' Hu Chengzhong is the chairman of China Delixi Holding Group.\r\n\r\n', "The group's diversified interests include mining, transportation, environmental engineering and real estate.", 'The group has 21,000 employees.']
person.name: Hu Chengzhong

bios: ['Zhou Zongwen chairs Chow Tai Seng Jewelry, which listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2017.', 'Zhou is a graduate of the China University of Geosciences.', 'Zhou opened the first Chow Tai Seng jewelry store in Beijing in 1999.']
person.name: Zhou Zongwen & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Duncan MacMillan cofounded financial data and media company Bloomberg LP in 1981 with Mike Bloomberg, Thomas Secunda and Charles Zegar.', 'MacMillan left a job at investment bank Salomon Brothers to help Bloomberg with what was then called Innovative Market Systems. ', "He is credited with designing many of Bloomberg LP's computer systems.", 'Bloomberg has estimated revenues of $10 billion.']
abouts: ['An active philanthropist, MacMillan has signed the Giving Pledge, a promise to give at least half of his fortune to charitable causes. ', 'MacMillan served four years in the Marine Corps after graduating from high school. He graduated from Rutgers University in 1966. ']
person.name: Duncan MacMillan

name: Real-Time Billionaires

bios: ["After a stint at Goldman Sachs' risk arbitrage department, Edward Lampert founded hedge fund ESL Investments in 1988, betting on undervalued stocks.", 'He took over as CEO of struggling retail giant Sears Holdings (Sears, Kmart, Kenmore) in 2013 with hopes of a turnaround, but failed miserably. ', 'In the first 10 months of 2017, his ESL Investments promised Sears nearly $1 billion in loans.', 'Struggling with declining sales, Sears announced in July 2017 that it would start selling its line of Kenmore-branded appliances on Amazon.', 'In January 2019 Lampert won an auction to keep the company, with a reported bid of more than $5 billion.', 'The company sued Lampert, former board Steve Mnuchin and others in 2019 for allegedly enriching themselves at the expense of the business.']
abouts: ['Lampert survived a kidnapping in 2003; his captors released him after two days.', 'A graduate of Yale University, he was a part of the secret society Skull and Bones, whose alumni include former presidents George H.W. Bush and George W. Bush. ']
person.name: Edward Lampert

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Electrical engineer Rit Thirakomen chairs Bangkok-listed MK Restaurant Group known for its value-for-money 'sukiyaki' restaurants.", 'The restaurant chain was founded by his late mother-in-law as a small Thai eatery in 1962.', 'After co-founding a book publishing business in 1974, he took to the restaurant trade in 1987, expanding into sukiyaki with wife Yupin. ', 'Today, MK has more than 650 restaurants, including Japanese food chain Yayoi.']
abouts: ['At MK Suki Restaurants customers cook their own food in a hotpot at their table.\r\n']
person.name: Rit Thirakomen

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Gary Lauder's fortune stems from Este Lauder, the cosmetics giant founded by his grandmother.", "His father Leonard ran the family's publicly traded company for more than three decades and stepped down as CEO in 1999. ", 'Lauder, who is not involved with the family company, is managing director of Lauder Partners LLC, a Silicon Valley-based venture capital firm. ', 'A venture capitalist since 1985, he has invested in over 60 private companies. ', 'He is the largest investor in Shotspotter, a publicly-traded company whose technology detects and locates gunshots for immediate response.', 'Lauder is co-inventor of 16 patents, such as text message authentication for social media platforms, a cable TV system, and a heliostat.']
person.name: Gary Lauder

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Chung Mong-joon is the largest shareholder of shipbuilder Hyundai Heavy Industries. ', 'He is the sixth son of the late Hyundai group founder Chung Ju-yung, who got his start repairing trucks for the U.S. Army after the Korean War.', 'Chung ran Hyundai Heavy Industries until he entered politics in 1988; he served seven terms in the National Assembly.']
abouts: ['In 2014 he ran for mayor of Seoul but lost.', 'He is a former vice president of international soccer body FIFA. ']
person.name: Chung Mong-joon

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Xie Zhikun is the founder of Beijing-headquartered Zhongzhi Enterprise Group.', 'Xie got his start as an entrepreneur in the timber business and real estate in the 1990s before moving into financial services.  <br', 'Xie is also known as Forest Xie.', 'Xie founded Zhongzhi in 1995. The asset management firm now has 10,000 employees.']
person.name: Xie Zhikun

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Mohammed "Mo" Ibrahim founded Celtel International in 1998, one of the first mobile phone companies serving Africa and the Middle East.', "He sold it to Kuwait's Mobile Telecommunications Company for $3.4 billion in 2005 and pocketed $1.4 billion. ", "Since then, he's focused on fighting corrupt leadership in Africa through the Mo Ibrahim Foundation, directed by his daughter, Hadeel."]
abouts: ['Ibrahim also owns the majority of assets in Satya Capital, a private equity fund that invests in African businesses, education and healthcare. ', 'He was born in Sudan.']
person.name: Mohammed Ibrahim

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Francois Feuillet became a billionaire after shares of French motorhome manufacturing company Trigano reached an all-time high in January 2018.', 'Started in 1935, Trigano first made camping equipment and then branched out to become a leader in European leisure vehicles. ', 'Feuillet joined Trigano in 1981 and has led the company ever since, taking it public in 1998. He currently owns 58% of the business.', 'He previously worked in finance and had an auditing job at KPMG. ']
abouts: ["Feuillet's wife helps run the company as its general manager. His two daughters serve on the supervisor's board. "]
person.name: Francois Feuillet

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Andrei Filatov made his first money selling imported goods while taking part in international chess tournaments.', 'In 1996 together with Konstantin Nikolaev and Nikita Mishin, he founded a transport joint venture with Alexei Mordashov. They later bought him.', 'Today the trio own more than a third of Globaltrans, the biggest private rail transport operator in Russia.', 'In December of 2017 all three withdrew from port business, selling their stakes in Global Ports.']
abouts: ['Filatov is the president of Russian Chess Federation.', 'Filatov owns wine production farm La Grace Dieu Des Prieurs in France,  founded in 1885. The vineyard produces 35,000 bottles of wine a year.']
person.name: Andrei Filatov

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Sara Blakely is founder and owner of shapewear brand Spanx, which sells undergarments, leggings, swimwear and maternity wear in 65 countries. ', 'A onetime door-to-door fax machine salesperson, Blakely made a makeshift undergarment using pantyhose to wear under white slacks.\r\n', 'She initially shilled her new invention, which became shapewear brand Spanx, on the sales floor at various Neiman Marcus stores.', "While Spanx is a celebrity favorite, Blakely is becoming a celebrity herself. She is a guest judge on 'Shark Tank' and had a cameo in 'Billions.'", 'Since 2015, she has been a co-owner of the Atlanta Hawks basketball team, along with billionaire Tony Ressler.\r\n']
abouts: ['Her husband Jessie Itzler is the founder of private jet membership company Marquis Jets, which was acquired by Net Jets in 2010.']
person.name: Sara Blakely

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Pradip Burman gets his wealth from a 9% stake in listed consumer goods outfit Dabur.', 'He chairs privately held Ayurvet, which makes a range of herbal products for animals.', 'Burman is chairman of Dabur Nepal and also sits on the board of Aviva Life Insurance. ', 'In 2015, he founded the Mobius Foundation, a non-profit aimed at promoting environmental sustainability.', "In 2018, India's law enforcement agency alleged that Burman had made deposits in a Swiss bank in violation of foreign exchange laws. Burman denied any such violation. "]
person.name: Pradip Burman

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Richard Kayne cofounded alternative asset manager Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors.', 'The $26 billion (assets under management) company is the largest investor in energy pipelines in the United States.', 'Kayne began his career as an analyst in New York in the mid 1960s then managed money at financials services firm Cantor Fitzgerald. ', 'He launched Kayne Anderson in 1984 and remains its co-chairman. ']
person.name: Richard Kayne

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Matthew Calkins is the cofounder and CEO of Appian, a software development service with over $175 million in revenue. ', 'Calkins cofounded the Reston, Virginia-based cloud computing company when he was 26. It went public on Nasdaq in May 2017.', "Nearly one third of Appian's 350 customers are on the Forbes Global list of the world's biggest companies.", 'Calkins is also a board game player and designer who has won at the World Boardgaming Championships.']
abouts: ['A game theory whiz, Calkins wrote a thesis paper at Dartmouth explaining when a losing hockey team should pull its goalie.']
person.name: Matthew Calkins

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Jayshree Ullal has been president and CEO of Arista Networks, a computer networking firm, since 2008.', 'The publicly-traded company recorded revenues of $2.2 billion in 2018.', "Ullal owns about 5% of Arista's stock, some of which is earmarked for her two children, niece and nephew.", "In August 2018, Arista settled a multi-year patent infringement battle with Cisco, Ullal's former employer, agreeing to pay Cisco $400 million. \r\n\r\n", "Born in London and raised in India, she is now one of America's wealthiest female executives."]
abouts: ['Ullal studied electrical engineering at San Francisco State University and engineering management at Santa Clara University.', 'Ullal joined Arista when it had no revenues and fewer than 50 employees. ']
person.name: Jayshree Ullal

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Fred Luddy, a serial entrepreneur, cofounded enterprise software company ServiceNow in 2004, a few weeks before he turned 50. ', 'At the time, Luddy had just lost a nearly $35 million fortune when his previous employer, Peregrine Systems, filed for bankruptcy.', 'Advised by Sequoia Capital, Luddy turned down a $2.5 billion acquisition offer for ServiceNow in 2011 and took it public the next year.', 'Luddy stepped down as CEO in 2011 to serve as chief product officer, a role he held until 2017. In June 2018, he became chairman of the board.', 'ServiceNow had $2.6 billion in 2018 revenues and more than 5,400 customers.']
person.name: Frederic Luddy

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Kerr Neilson still owns more than half of international equities fund manager Platinum Asset Management together with his ex-wife Judith.', 'They had partially cashed out in a well-timed 2007 IPO.', 'Known for his value-based contrarian stock picks that have earned him comparisons with Warren Buffett, Neilson bought his first stock at age 13.', 'A Johannesburg native, he cofounded Platinum in 1994, after moving to Sydney from South Africa a decade earlier to work for Bankers Trust Australia.']
person.name: Kerr Neilson

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Gaston Glock is the founder and majority owner of the Austrian gun manufacturer Glock GmbH. ', 'An engineer, Glock had his start by designing and manufacturing a pistol for the Austrian army in the early 1980s.', 'Glock spends most of his time in his mansion in Austria with his second wife Kathrin, who is more than 50 years his junior.', 'Glock, with sales of more than $500 million globally in 2017, has a nearly 65% market share of the handguns in the U.S., based on analyst estimates.', "Counsel for Glock strongly objected to his inclusion in the billionaire ranks and disputed Forbes' valuation."]
abouts: ['Rappers like Snoop Dogg and the Wu-Tang Clan have mentioned the gun in songs like Wu\'s 2001 hit "Da Glock."', 'His second wife Kathrin is more than 50 years his junior.']
person.name: Gaston Glock & family

bios: ['Yu Rong chairs Meinian Onehealth Healthcare Holdings, which offers health exams throughout China.', "Yu holds a doctor's degree of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences and an EMBA of China Europe International Business School."]
person.name: Yu Rong

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Johannes Kaercher owns 50% of the world's largest privately held cleaning equipment company, Alfred Kaercher GmbH & Co. KG.", 'Ownership transferred to him and his sister Susanne Zimmerman von Siefart years after the death of their father Alfred, who founded Kaercher in 1935.', 'Although not involved in the active management of the company, Kaercher chairs its supervisory board.', 'The company employs over 12,300 people and generates more than $2.8 billion in annual revenue.']
abouts: ['In 1950, the company created the first European hot-water pressure washer.', "Kaercher is Protestant, and he gave the Reformation Day sermon at Berlin's St. Matthew's Church (Matthaeuskirche) in 2016."]
person.name: Johannes Kaercher

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Susanne Zimmerman von Siefart owns 50% of the world's largest privately held cleaning equipment company, Alfred Kaercher GmbH & Co. KG.", 'Ownership was transferred to her and her brother Johannes Kaercher years after the death of their father Alfred, who founded Kaercher in 1935.', 'Although not involved in the active management of the company, Zimmerman von Siefart is a member of its supervisory board.', 'The company employs over 12,300 people and generates more than $2.8 billion in annual revenue.']
abouts: ['In 1950, the company created the first European hot-water pressure washer.', 'Susanne was CEO of Sigiriya Schmuck und Textil, a shop selling Sri Lankan-style jewelry.']
person.name: Susanne Zimmermannvon Siefart

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Andrei Rappoport worked for two billionaires, Michael Fridman and Michail Khodorkovsky, before becoming one himself. ', "Rappoport worked at Fridman's Alfa-Bank for four years, then joined Khodorkovsky's YUKOS-Rosprom before moving to RAO Unified Energy System.", 'After RAO UES, he bought Georgian Global Utilities and a Georgian water and power company that he then sold to BGEO Group in 2016.', 'These days he has cashed out of nearly all his investments. ']
abouts: ['Rappoport is a master of sports in high-speed pistol shooting.', 'Rappoport decided to start a bank when he was 28 years old, but had no money. Instead he joined Alfa Bank after seeing an ad in the newspaper.   ']
person.name: Andrei Rappoport

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Xu Qiming made his earliest money in eel farming at his China Xulong Group, one of China's largest eel exporters.", "Over the years Xu has built on his eel fortune with one of China's best private art collections.", 'SInce 2010, Xu has donated at least 6 pieces of art to the National Museum of China.']
person.name: Xu Qiming

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'ISTANBUL', 'ticker': 'DGGYO-TR', 'companyName': 'Dogus Gayrimenkul Yatirim Ortakligi A.S.', 'numberOfShares': 24970000, 'sharePrice': 0.7612166022517225, 'currencyCode': 'TRY', 'exchangeRate': 5.951, 'interactive': False}, {'exchange': 'ISTANBUL', 'ticker': 'DOAS-TR', 'companyName': 'Dogus Otomotiv', 'numberOfShares': 32340000.000000004, 'sharePrice': 1.5997311376239287, 'currencyCode': 'TRY', 'exchangeRate': 5.951, 'interactive': False}, {'exchange': 'ISTANBUL', 'ticker': 'GARAN-TR', 'companyName': 'Turkiye Garanti Bankasi A.S.', 'numberOfShares': 0, 'sharePrice': 1.871954293396068, 'currencyCode': 'TRY', 'exchangeRate': 5.951, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Deniz Sahenk is the widow of Ayhan Sahenk, the founder of Dogus Holding who died of a heart attack in 2001.', 'Dogus operates in sectors ranging from tourism, real estate and media to financial services, construction and auto import and distribution.', "Most of the fortune derives from Garanti Bank. The family sold its remaining 10% of Garanti to Spain's BBVA in 2017, bringing in $900 million.", "Dogus' hotel portfolio includes the Astir Palace and Athens Hilton in Greece, the Capri Palace in Italy and Rome's Aldrovandi Villa Borghese.", 'Deniz Sahenk has no active role in the Dogus companies. Her son, Ferit, is president of Dogus Holding.']
abouts: ["Both Ferit and Deniz's daughter, Feliz, who manages the branded clothing and tourism components of Dogus, are also billionaires."]
person.name: Deniz Sahenk

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Kenneth Lo founded clothing manufacturer Crystal Group with his wife in 1970. ', "He built a modest sweater factory into one of Asia's largest garment manufacturers, with 81,000 employees at 20 sites around the world. ", "Notable customers include Levi's, Victoria's Secret, Abercrombie & Fitch and J. C. Penney.", 'Lo is chairman of the group while his son Andrew is chief executive.', 'He is the eldest son of the late textile magnate Law Ting-pong. His brother is fellow billionaire Law Kar Po.']
abouts: ['Lo published a memoir in 2016 that credits his fighting spirit and strong character to hardscrabble beginnings as the oldest of six children.', 'When he was a child, Lo and his father Law Ting-pong worked on a farm, and then odd jobs. He attended a Catholic school for the poor, where he got the name Kenneth.']
person.name: Kenneth Lo

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Francis Holder founded and runs Groupe Holder, a French baking conglomerate with annual revenues of $1 billion.', 'His Paul bakery-cafe chain counts 740 stores in 43 countries, and its high-end macaron house Laduree has 85 shops in 50 countries.', "His white-label firm Chateau Blanc sells more than 500 kinds of breads, pastries and macaron to more than 200 clients worldwide, including McDonald's.", "Chateau Blanc's factory in Lille, France makes more than 30,000 macaron shells an hour.", "Holder took over his family's small bakery at 18 years old, after his father died of a heart attack at 51 years old. "]
abouts: ['Holder plans to create a baking museum in Paris with his collection of more than 18,000 paintings and books on the subject.', "Holder started apprenticing at his family's bakery at 15 years old after finishing middle school."]
person.name: Francis Holder

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Anna Maria Braun is CEO of medical device company B. Braun Melsungen, which began in 1839 as a small pharmacy that sold herbal remedies.', 'Her father, Ludwig Georg Braun, took the reins in 1977, when the company had just $24 million in annual sales (now around $8 billion).', 'Today, with 60,000 employees globally, B. Braun manufactures products ranging from infusion and injection solutions to surgical instruments.']
abouts: ['A sixth-generation family member, she owns 10% of the company and previously served as president of its Asian/Pacific operations.', "Her billionaire brother Otto Philipp Braun was responsible for the company's Iberian Peninsula and Latin American regions before stepping down in February 2017."]
person.name: Anna Maria Braun

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Johanna Braun owns 10% of the medical device company B. Braun Melsungen, which began in 1839 as a small pharmacy that sold herbal remedies.', 'Her father, Ludwig Georg Braun, took the reins in 1977, when the company had just $24 million in annual sales (now around $8 billion).', 'Today, with 60,000 employees globally, B. Braun manufactures products ranging from infusion and injection solutions to surgical instruments.']
abouts: ['A sixth-generation family member, Johanna is the youngest daughter of Ludwig Georg.', 'B. Braun has been operating in Africa for more than 60 years, and now has subsidiaries in Zambia, Algeria, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.']
person.name: Johanna Braun

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Karl Friedrich Braun owns 10% of the medical device company B. Braun Melsungen, which began in 1839 as a small pharmacy that sold herbal remedies.', 'His father, Ludwig Georg Braun, took the reins in 1977, when the company had just $24 million in annual sales (now around $8 billion).', 'Today, with 60,000 employees globally, B. Braun manufactures products ranging from infusion and injection solutions to surgical instruments.']
abouts: ['A sixth-generation family member, Karl Friedrich is one of the three sons of Ludwig Georg.', 'B. Braun has been operating in Africa for more than 60 years, and now has subsidiaries in Zambia, Algeria, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.']
person.name: Karl Friedrich Braun

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Simon Nixon earned the bulk of his fortune from his price-comparison website MoneySuperMarket.', 'He co-founded the company in 1993, took it public in 2007, and when he fully divested in 2016, he became a billionaire. ', 'Now, Nixon is an investor in dozens of private companies, including Airbnb, Robinhood and Transferwise.', 'He also owns luxury homes around the globe, including in Malibu and Barbados, which he lists for private holiday rentals on his site, SimonEscapes.']
abouts: ['In 2013, Nixon moved from Chester, England, to tax haven Jersey, where he owns a multi-million dollar home.', 'Nixon studied accounting at Nottingham University before dropping out at the age of 20.']
person.name: Simon Nixon

name: Real-Time Billionaires

bios: ['Analjit Singh is the youngest son of Bhai Mohan Singh, founder of pharma firm Ranbaxy Laboratories.', 'Today he controls the $2.9 billion (revenue) Max Group, with interests in healthcare, insurance and specialty packaging film.', 'Singh announced in December 2018 that he plans to sell his healthcare and insurance interests.', 'In recent years, Singh has invested in South Africa where he owns a vineyard and two boutique resorts. \r\n', 'His son, Veer, runs Vana, a private wellness retreat in the northern Indian city of Dehradun.']
abouts: ["The Boston University grad made an early investment in India's telecom sector and made a pile when he sold his stake in that business to Li Ka-shing.", 'His daughter founded Antara, a senior living community in North India.']
person.name: Analjit Singh

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Soichiro Fukutake inherited and expanded Benesse Holdings, which provides education and other services, including senior care and language classes.', 'He now serves as an honorary advisor to the company. His son Hideaki Fukutake is a board member.', "The company is listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange; Fukutake's family owns a 15% stake. ", 'In 2014 Benesse purchased Tokyo-based Minerva, which runs 400 English-language schools for children.', 'The Fukutake Foundation supports art, science and regional Japanese culture. ']
person.name: Soichiro Fukutake

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Thai property tycoon Anant Asavabhokin's biggest asset is a 24% stake in SET-listed Land And Houses.", 'He founded the company with his mother, Piangjai Harnpanij, in 1983.', 'The company is known for its focus on semi-detached houses.', 'In 2017, he resigned from the chairmanship of four of his companies over money laundering charges. He denied any wrongdoing.']
person.name: Anant Asavabhokin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Yves-Loic Martin is the former chief technology officer of Eurofins Scientific, a  laboratory testing company listed on the French stock exchange. ', 'The company went public in 1997 IPO and Martin owns about 11% of stock. ', 'He joined Eurofins in 1992 and became chief technology officer in 1998. He stepped down in 2015 but remains a board member.', 'Eurofins has 400 labs in 41 countries and is prominent in food and pharmaceutical products testing. ', "Martin's billionaire brother, Gilles, founded the lab in 1987 and remains CEO."]
person.name: Yves-Loic Martin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Mehmet Hattat's companies operate in manufacturing, mining, energy and real estate.", 'At a complex of 11 factories, Hattat make parts and components for autos, commercial vehicles and companies in the aviation and defense industries.', 'Hattat makes Massey Ferguson and Ferrari tractors for the foreign market, as well as  tractors bearing the Hattat brand name.', 'Hattat is developing a project (hotel, shopping center, conference center and office space) on land he owns in the affluent Maslak area of Istanbul.', 'He plans on using coal from a mine he owns in Northern Turkey to fuel a nearby 1320 MW thermal power plant, in which he is an investor.']
abouts: ['He owns two vases from the Napoleonic era bearing the initials of Napoleon and his wife, Josephine.']
person.name: Mehmet Hattat

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Du Shaunghua chairs Rizhao Steel Holding Group.\r\n\r\n', "Rizhao Steel Holding is one of China's largest private steel manufacturers.", 'Du is a philanthropist whose donations have supported youth causes.']
person.name: Du Shuanghua

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Gustavo Cisneros owns the Cisneros Group, a conglomerate with interests in Venezuelan television, telecom, a brewery, real estate and a baseball team.', 'In 2007 Cisneros and his partners sold Spanish-language TV network Univision to a group of private equity firms for $12.3 billion (excluding debt). ', "Cisneros's daughter, Adriana, became CEO in 2013 and restructured the group into 4 branches: media, interactive, real estate and products & services. ", 'In October 2016, Gustavo and wife Patricia gave more than 100 pieces from their Latin American art collection to the Museum of Modern Art in New York.', 'Cisneros, who is of Cuban heritage, has been a vocal proponent for the normalization of relations between the United States and Cuba.']
abouts: ['In 2000, the Cisneros Group moved its headquarters from Caracas to South Florida. ']
person.name: Gustavo Cisneros & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Alfred West runs SEI, the $1.4 billion (revenue) financial services firm he founded in 1968.', 'SEI, which stands for Simulated Environments Inc., first developed a computer program to train loan officers by simulating a lending environment.', 'West took SEI public in 1981 and branched out into investment advisory and money management.']
abouts: ['West dreamed of becoming a fighter pilot when he was younger and studied aerospace engineering at Georgia Tech.', "He didn't qualify to fly due to poor eyesight, so he got an MBA at Wharton instead and then launched SEI."]
person.name: Alfred West Jr

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Donald Friese's fortune stems from C.R. Laurence, which manufactures or distributes more than 65,000 products for the glass industry.", 'In 2015 he sold C.R. Laurence to a big customer, Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope, a subsidiary of Irish conglomerate CRH, for $1.3 billion in cash. ', 'Friese grew up a poor orphan in rural Pennsylvania, going to work on a dairy farm at age 12 before enlisting in the Army after high school.', 'After a three-year tour, he moved to California with just $125 and landed in the warehouse of C.R. Laurence, then a small distributor of supplies.', 'He climbed the ladder, amassing equity in the company until he owned 100%, and expanded by purchasing competitors and moving into manufacturing.']
abouts: ['When Friese sold C.R. Laurence, he gave his employees $85 million. All 1,600 longtime workers got a bonus check -- some for more than $1 million.', 'Since he retired in August 2018, Friese has been focusing on philanthropy through his family foundation. He has so far donated $60 million to the organization.  ']
person.name: Donald Friese

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Golub is president of Golub Capital and CEO of the $30 billion in assets firm's publicly traded finance arm.", 'After stints at Centre Partners and a fund affiliated with Lazard, Golub joined his brother at Golub Capital in 2003.', "Golub is on the board of Burton Snowboards and also spends significant time backing Parkinson's research with the Michael J. Fox Foundation. "]
abouts: ['After graduating from Harvard, David Golub was awarded a Marshall Scholarship and earned a masters in philosophy from Oxford University. ']
person.name: David Golub

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Mark Yang, also known as Yang Haoyong, is the chairman of Guazi, an online site that sells second-hand cars.', 'Yang earlier founded online classified site Ganji, which was acquired by 58.com.', 'He holds degrees from Yale University and the University of Science and Technology of China.']
person.name: Mark Haoyong Yang

bios: ['Chen Tianqiao is the founder, chairman and CEO of Shanda Investment Group, founded in 1999 by Chen and his family.', 'Chen is credited with having pioneered and built the online game industry and the online literature industry in China.', 'Chen stepped down as CEO of Shanda Interactive Entertainment in 2012 and then took the company private.', 'Chen and his wife Chrissy are active philanthropists, supporting research programs on brain science.']
person.name: Chen Tianqiao

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Low profile brothers Murli Dhar and Bimal Gyanchandani control family's Kanpur-headquartered consumer goods firm RSPL Group.\r\n", 'RSPL is best known for its low-cost Ghari detergent, which is popular in north India. ', "Murli Dhar's two sons work in the group, along with Bimal's son Rohit, after whom the flagship Rohit Surfactants is named. ", "The brothers' other interests include real estate and footwear under the Red Chief brand. \r\n"]
abouts: ['The siblings have set up a charitable hospital in Kanpur named after their parents.', "Ghari means 'clock' in Hindi."]
person.name: Murli Dhar & Bimal Kumar Gyanchandani

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '300124-CN', 'companyName': 'Shenzhen Inovance Technology Co Ltd ', 'numberOfShares': 225926000, 'sharePrice': 4.398696469845098, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}, {'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '300124-CN', 'companyName': 'Shenzhen Inovance Technology Co Ltd ', 'numberOfShares': -4113000.0000000005, 'sharePrice': 4.398696469845098, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Zhu Xingming co-founded and chairs Shenzhen Inovance Technology, a supplier of industrial automation control product.', 'Inovance went public at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2010.', 'Zhu holds a graduate degree from Yanshan University.']
person.name: Zhu Xingming

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Basudeo Singh is the executive chairman of Indian generics firm Alkem Laboratories.', "His son Dhananjay Kumar Singh, Alkem's joint managing director,  has been named to succeed him as executive chairman.\r\n", "Basudeo Singh is the cousin of Alkem's billionaire founder Samprada Singh."]
person.name: Basudeo Singh

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Chinese-Thai businessman Chanchai Ruayrungruang, also known as Yan Bin, leads the privately held Reignwood Group. \r\n', "Reignwood's best-known assets are Reignwood Centre - an office, hotel and retail complex in Beijing, and the Pine Valley golf course, also in Beijing.", 'Chanchai started the business in Thailand in 1984 and moved into China a dozen years later. ']
person.name: Chanchai Ruayrungruang

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Property developer's son Achal Bakeri branched out into manufacturing in 1988 by borrowing $1,500 from his father. \r\n", "Today his Bombay Stock Exchange-listed Symphony is the world's biggest producer of air coolers selling 1.2 million units annually in 60 countries. \r\n", 'Symphony also owns Munters Keruilai, a Swedish-Chinese joint venture, which gives it a foothold in China and the Asean region. ', 'In 2018, Symphony expanded its international footprint with the acquisition of Climate Technologies, an Australian air cooling firm. ']
abouts: ['Symphony air coolers are used in such places as the walkways at Heathrow airport, Wal-Mart stores and temples in India. ', "Bakeri's assets include a share in the family's real estate holdings in and around Ahmedabad city.\r\n"]
person.name: Achal Bakeri

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Sun Qinghuan chairs MLS, one of China's largest makers of light-emitting diodes. \r\n", 'Sun, who founded MLS in 1997, became a billionaire after the company went public in February 2015 on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange. \r\n']
person.name: Sun Qinghuan

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Vladimir Leschikov owns more than 370 acres of land near the border between Moscow and New Moscow territory.', "That's where his shopping complex Slavyanskiy Mir (Slavic world), with a space of about 3 million square feet, is located.", 'Leschikov was born in Dagestan in the North Caucasus region.   ', 'Leschikov and his older brother moved to Moscow bought rooms in the center of Moscow to lease them.', "Moscow's government plans to build two metro stations on Leschikov's land.  "]
person.name: Vladimir Leschikov

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'SHENZHEN', 'ticker': '002304-CN', 'companyName': 'Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery Joint-Stock Co Ltd', 'numberOfShares': 54492000, 'sharePrice': 15.863445167032745, 'currencyCode': 'CNY', 'exchangeRate': 6.9657, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ["Yang Tingdong's fortune comes from a stake in rice-wine supplier Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery.", 'Yang chaired the company from 2002 to 2012.']
person.name: Yang Tingdong

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Xu Bo is the founder and chairman of Guangzhou Duoyi Network, one of China's largest mobile game companies.", 'Xu started the predecessor to Duoyi in 2006 with an investment from Kingsoft.']
person.name: Xu Bo

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Laurie Tisch's late father Bob (d. 2005) started Loews Corporation with his brother Laurence as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.", 'Today, Loews is active in insurance, drilling rigs, natural gas pipelines, and hotels.', "Laurie's mother Joan Tisch (d. 2017) was the largest individual Loews shareholder with 6%. Laurie and her two siblings inherited her mother's stake.", 'In 1991, her father Bob bought a 50% stake in the New York Giants football team for $75 million.', "Laurie's brother Steve Tisch is chairman and executive vice president of the New York Giants NFL team, which FORBES values at $3.9 billion."]
abouts: ['An avid art collector, Laurie Tisch is a trustee at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York City.', 'In 2008, Tisch worked with then-New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg to launch NYC Green Carts, which provides fresh produce to "food deserts" throughout the city.']
person.name: Laurie Tisch

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios:
['Boris Rotenberg and his older brother, Arkady, are co-owners of SMP Bank.', 'The Rotenberg brothers were hit by U.S. sanctions and had assets frozen in 2014 because of their close ties to President Vladimir Putin. ', 'The U.S. Treasury claimed that Putin had awarded the Rotenbergs billions of dollars in contracts with Gazprom and for the Sochi Olympics.', 'Unlike Arkady, Boris was not subject to European Union sanctions because he has Finnish citizenship.
']
abouts: ['Boris is vice president of the Russian Judo Federation. He sponsors the SMP Racing Project, which supports young Russian drivers.', 'In 2018 Finnish Defense Forces banned Rotenberg from building a guest house on his site because it is located near a military base.']
person.name: Boris Rotenberg

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Steven Tisch is chairman and executive vice president of NFL's NY Giants. His late father Bob paid $75 million in 1991 for a 50% stake in the team.", "Steven's father Bob Tisch (d. 2005) cofounded Loews Corp. with his brother Laurence as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.", 'Today, Loews Corp., a publicly traded company, is active in insurance, drilling rigs, natural gas pipelines and hotels.', "Steven's mother Joan (d. 2017) was the largest individual shareholder (with 6%) of Loews, where his brother Jonathan is co-chairman.", "Steven and his two siblings, Jonathan and Laurie, inherited their mother's fortune."]
abouts: ['Steven is the only known person to have won both an Academy Award and a Super Bowl ring: he won an Oscar for producing Forrest Gump, and the Giants won two Super Bowls.', 'Steven has been a movie producer for decades, working on hit films including Risky Business, American History X, and The Pursuit of Happyness. ']
person.name: Steven Tisch

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Rodney Lewis grew up on the border in Laredo, Texas.', 'Lewis started Lewis Petro Properties in 1983 with one natural gas well.', 'He eventually acquired 500,000 acres in the Eagle Ford shale and became the fourth-biggest gas producer in Texas.', "He owns America's biggest fleet of air-worthy World War II fighter planes, including a P-38 dug out of a Greenland glacier and restored.", 'In 2004 Lewis was the first U.S. oilman to sign a contract to drill for Pemex in Mexico.']
abouts: ['Lewis beat esophageal cancer a decade ago, but lost his salivary glands.', 'An avid collector of World War II-era fighter planes, Lewis is a board member of the National Air and Space Museum in Washington, D.C.  ']
person.name: Rodney Lewis

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["In 1984, Guy Lalibert, a former street performer, cofounded Cirque du Soleil, which would become one of the world's biggest entertainment companies.", 'His empire began with a show, funded by $1 million from the Canadian government, put on for the 450th anniversary of the discovery of Canada.', 'The celebration went global, and the shows have been performed for more than 180 million spectators across more than 400 cities on six continents.', ' In 2015 he sold much of his 90% stake to U.S. private equity firm TPG Capital and Chinese investment group Fosun, keeping 10% of the company.', 'In 2017, he founded Lune Rouge, which develops and invests in projects in arts, technology and entertainment.\r\n']
abouts: ['Guy Lalibert was the first private Canadian citizen to explore space as part of a 2009 mission to raise awareness on water issues facing humankind.', 'In 2007, Guy Lalibert founded One Drop, a foundation devoted to making clean and safe water accessible around the world.\r\n']
person.name: Guy Lalibert

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Len Ainsworth founded Aristocrat Leisure, the world's second-biggest gaming-machine company, in 1953. He stepped aside in 1994 after a cancer scare.", "He gave his large stake in Aristocrat Leisure to his seven sons and ex-wife more than 20 years ago; he's entitled to some proceeds if they sell. ", 'He started a similar company, Ainsworth Game Technology, the following year at age 72.', 'He stepped down as executive director at age 94 after selling his majority stake to Austrian gaming giant Novomatic.', 'He signed the giving pledge in March 2017.']
person.name: Len Ainsworth

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Wolfgang Egger is founder and CEO of publicly traded real estate company Patrizia AG.', 'Based in Augsburg, Germany, it employs around 700 people across 15 countries and manages around $50 billion in real estate assets.', "Egger started Patrizia in 1984 and took it public in 2006. With more than 50%, he's still the biggest shareholder.", "Patrizia's portfolio comprises approximately 700 properties with more than 200 institutional investors."]
abouts: ['After starting out as a dental laboratory technician, Egger quickly realized his love for real estate and founded Patrizia at the age of 19.', 'He supports charitable social projects around the world through his Patrizia Kinderhaus-Stiftung.']
person.name: Wolfgang Egger

bios: ['George Yancopoulos is the chief scientific officer of biotech firm Regeneron. ', 'He received his M.D. and Ph.D. from Columbia University and became a professor of biology by age 28.  ', 'Regeneron was cofounded by now-billionaire Leonard Schleifer in 1988. Yancopoulos joined the next year.', 'Yancopoulos led the invention of seven approved drugs and a technology platform designed to invent more.']
abouts: ['Yancopoulos was the first pharmaceutical research chief to become a billionaire.', 'Yancopoulos was a finalist in the Westinghouse Science Talent Search in 1976. Today, its called the Regeneron Science Talent Search and is sponsored by his company.']
person.name: George Yancopoulos

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Susan Slavik Williams owns about 5% of industrial supply firm W.W. Grainger, which did $10.8 billion in net sales in 2017.', 'Since 1989, Williams has served as a director of Mark IV Capital, a real estate firm based in Newport Beach, California.', 'She sits on the board of the St. Louis Zoo and on the Friends Committee of Missouri Baptist Hospital.', 'Williams serves as CEO of the Donald Slavik Family Foundation, which focuses on protecting wildlife and educating the public on environmental issues.']
abouts: ['Williams and her husband Felix owned a custom home electronics firm called the Screening Room for 10 years.']
person.name: Susan Williams

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['A pioneer of the modern hedge fund, Michael Steinhardt closed his fund in 1995 after making a fortune in the 1990s from stellar returns.', 'He came out of retirement a decade later to help run WisdomTree Investments, where he is the chairman and a leading shareholder.', 'WisdomTree is a publicly traded asset manager that focuses on ETF investing.', 'Steinhardt cofounded Birthright Israel, a foundation that provides funding for young Jewish Americans to take heritage trips to Israel.']
abouts: ['He maintains a zoo at his 57-acre Bedford, N.Y. estate -- complete with 90-year-old land tortoises, rare zonkies, camels and "oodles and oodles of berries."']
person.name: Michael Steinhardt

bios: ['Dan and his brother Farris got a combined $3.5 billion (pretax) in 2011 selling their fracking company to a group led by Singapore-based firm Temasek.', "The brothers have acquired more than 672,000 acres of land in six different states across the West, becoming America's 12th-largest landowners.", "They first founded Wilks Masonry in 1995, following in their stone mason father's footsteps.", 'In 2002 they went into fracking, launching Frac Tech and growing it into an oil and natural gas giant before cashing out less than a decade later.', 'The brothers are also investing in oil and gas businesses, including Canadian oilfield services company Trican Well Service.']
abouts: ['Like his brother, Dan is a GOP financial backer, donating millions to Republican Super PACs during the 2016 election cycle.', 'The brothers reportedly spend four months a year in Montana, working on building homes on their  large ranches.']
person.name: Dan Wilks

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Sun Mengquan chairs Shandong-based cooking oil company Luhua Group.', 'Sun began working for the predecessor of Luhua in 1983, when it was a nearly bankrupt metals trading collective with fewer than 10 workers. ', "Sun shifted the company's business to processing and exporting peanuts, and, later, into peanut oil."]
person.name: Sun Mengquan

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Yuri Gushchin gets the bulk of his fortune from United Confectioners, the biggest candy company in Russia.', 'During the Soviet era, Gushchin was an underground producer of consumer goods, particularly candy.', 'During Perestroika he became one of the first businessmen to legalize those operations.', "After the 1998 Russian financial crisis, he bought a controlling stake in Moscow's biggest confectionary factories and created United Confectioners.", 'Gushchin leases out buildings near the Kremlin including Red October that used to belong to the candy company.']
abouts: ['He lives in Seychelles where he owns a luxury hotel called Savoy Resort and Spa. He also owns the Savoy Hotel in Moscow.']
person.name: Yuri Gushchin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Richard Desmond founded Northern & Shell, which published the Daily Express newspapers, OK! and Star magazines, and operates UK's Health Lottery.", 'He was raised by his secretary mom in a garage apartment -- his parents divorced after his dad, an advertising executive, gambled away their savings.', "Desmond started his first magazine, International Musician, at age 22 with a $60,000 loan, then became Penthouse's U.K. licensee. ", 'He expanded to titles like Asian Babes and Posh Housewives, then sold some holdings and went mass market, launching OK! and buying Express Newspapers.', "In February 2018 he sold N&S's publishing arm, including its newspaper and magazine titles, to rival Trinity Mirror for about $177 million."]
abouts: ['In 2003, Desmond created the band RD Crusaders with Roger Daltrey from The Who and other musicians.', "He quit school at age 14 to become a drummer, then dressed up in his older brother's suit to land a job selling newspaper ads over the phone a year later. "]
person.name: Richard Desmond

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Yi Rubo chairs Zhong Ang Group, whose interests include real estate and decoration.', 'Zhong Ang was established in 2004.\r\n']
person.name: Yi Rubo

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Property developer P.N.C.Menon left Kerala in south India and migrated to Oman in 1976 to start an interior decorating business with a partner. ', 'Seeing an opportunity in real estate back home, Menon started Sobha Developers in 1995, in Bangalore, naming it after his wife.', 'Sobha Developers is run by son Ravi, an engineer from Purdue University, while Menon lives in Dubai.', "Menon's Sobha Realty in the Middle East has operations spanning the UAE, Qatar, Oman and other Gulf countries.", "Menon has said that after his death his wife will be Sobha's chairman and his son, Ravi, the co-chair."]
abouts: ["Sobha has a $6.8 billion joint venture with the government of Umm al-Quwain to develop the UAE's least-known emirate into a tourist hot spot.  ", 'Menon and his wife have signed the Giving Pledge.']
person.name: P.N.C. Menon

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Masayuki Ishihara and his immediate family own about 45% of Tokyo-listed pachinko machine maker Heiwa.', 'Ishihara is not involved in running Heiwa.', 'He founded another pachinko firm, Olympia, which Heiwa acquired in a stock swap in 2007.', "Heiwa subsidiary PGM is one of Japan's largest golf course operators."]
person.name: Masayuki Ishihara & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Alberto Palatchi transformed a store he inherited from his parents in 1964 into Pronovias, one of the largest wedding dress companies in the world.', 'In late 2017, Palatchi sold 90% of Pronovias to British private equity firm BC Partners for an estimated $550 million.', 'Pronovias wedding dresses are sold in 44 of its own stores and at thousands of retailers around the world.\r\n', 'Palatchi also has more than $600 million invested in two Spanish Sicav funds, which are similar to mutual funds.  ']
abouts: ["Palatchi's father fled Turkey during World War I and moved to Barcelona.", "In 1922 Palatchi's parents opened a store in Barcelona called El Suizo that sold lace and embroidery for wedding dresses."]
person.name: Alberto Palatchi

bios: ['Low-profile tycoon Surin Upatkoon made his fortune across sectors ranging from telecom to gaming to insurance.', 'Most of his fortune comes from selling a 10% stake in Thai telecom company InTouch in 2013. ', 'He owns stakes in listed gaming company Magnum Corp, textile firm MWE and insurance-and-property company MPHB Capital.', 'He started his career as a manager at MWE Weaving in 1971 and rose through the ranks.', 'His son, Krian, is on the textile company board while Ivevei, the older of his two daughters, is on the board of the financial-services company.']
abouts: ['Upatkoon is a Thai national but moved to Penang for school, stayed for work and has been a  Malaysia resident ever since.  ', 'He loves playing golf.']
person.name: Surin Upatkoon

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Sang-hyuk is the founder of the country's second-biggest unicorn, Yello Mobile. ", 'Launched in 2012, Yello operates as a tech incubator by growing and investing in young mobile-based startups. ', 'His company has been valued at $4 billion by investors; his ownership is just over 26%. ']
abouts: ['Lee worked as an executive for Korean search engine Daum for a year-and-a-half before leaving in 2013.', 'Yello Mobile has a portfolio of more than 80 companies across shopping, media, advertising and travel.']
person.name: Lee Sang-hyuk

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Koo Bon-sik runs LG affiliate Heesung Electronics with his brother Koo Bon-Neung, who is also one of the richest people in South Korea. ', 'He is the youngest of the four Koo brothers of the LG Group. ', "Heesung is LG's largest supplier of backlights, which are used to illuminate LCD displays.", "Heesung group's affiliates include LT Precision, LT metal and LT Material."]
abouts: ['More than 50% of his fortune comes from his stake in LG Corp. ', 'In 1947 his grandfather, the late Koo In-hwoi, cofounded LG, then called, Lak Hui Chemical Industrial Corp., with a popular face cream. ']
person.name: Koo Bon-sik

bios: ['Steven Roth is chairman and CEO of real estate investment trust Vornado Realty Trust.', 'Vornado owns more than 20 million square feet of Manhattan office and retail space, plus properties in San Francisco and Chicago.', 'Vornado owns two buildings alongside Donald Trump: 1290 Avenue of the Americas in New York City and 555 California Street in San Francisco.', "Roth served as an economic advisor to Trump's 2016 campaign, and was tapped for a spot on the president's short-lived infrastructure council.", 'His wife, Daryl, is a Broadway and off-Broadway producer.']
abouts: ["Roth purchased Bernie Madoff's Hamptons estate in October 2009 for $9.4 million.", "Roth once served on the boards of J.C. Penney and Toys 'R' Us."]
person.name: Steven Roth

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Luis Enrique Yarur Rey is the chairman of Banco de Credito e Inversiones (BCI), a Chilean retail and commercial bank.', 'BCI has more than 300 branches throughout Chile and Florida, and even one in Antarctica. ', "The bank was founded by the Yarur family in 1937. Today it is one of Chile's largest banking institutions, with more than $45 billion in assets. ", 'In 2015, BCI purchased City National Bank of Florida for $947 million; it was the first time a Chilean bank purchased a U.S. financial institution. ']
person.name: Luis Enrique Yarur Rey

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Cai Hongbin's fortune comes from his stake in Jiangsu Hengrui Medicine.", "Jiangsu Hengrui is one of China's largest pharmaceutical companies, employing more than 20,000 people. ", "Fellow Chinese billionaire Sun Piaoyang is Hengrui's chairman. "]
person.name: Cai Hongbin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Mustafa Kucuk is the biggest shareholder of LC Waikiki, a producer and retailer of ready-to-wear fashions and home items.', 'Kucuk and his partners purchased the business in 1997 and rapidly accelerated growth.', 'In 2018, LC Waikiki opened stores in Croatia, Greece and South Africa, bringing its total store count to over 900 in 44 countries.   ', 'In 2019, the company expects to generate around half of its $3 billion-plus in revenue from outside of Turkey.', "It's planning to expand into China, India, Indonesia and Malaysia."]
abouts: ['French designer Georges Amouyal and a partner created the brand, adding the name of the famous Hawaiian beach to "LC," as in "Les Copains" ("friends" in French).', 'Mustafa Kucuk avoids the media. His older brother, Vahap Kucuk, is the public face of the company.']
person.name: Mustafa Kucuk

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Satomi is the president and CEO of Sega Sammy, a Japanese pachinko machine and gaming software firm.', 'He founded pachinko machine maker Sammy, which got into the videogame business when it acquired Sega in 2004.', 'His son, Haruki, is the chairman and CEO of Sega Sammy.', 'Sega Sammy has a 45% stake in South Korean gambling-and-entertainment resort Paradise City, which opened in April 2017.', 'Satomi is also a top-ranked owner of thoroughbred horses. \r\n']
person.name: Hajime Satomi

bios: ["Pharma tycoon Chirayu Amin's Alembic Pharmaceuticals is one of India's oldest pharma companies.", "Alembic was founded by Amin's grandfather in 1907 to make tincture and alcohol. \r\n", 'Today, Alembic gets half of its $483 million annual revenue from the domestic market selling generic drugs, including popular cough syrup Glycodin. ', 'While Amin is chairman and chief executive, his 3 sons work in different parts of the business.']
abouts: ['Amin is the brother-in-law of consumer goods billionaire Harsh Mariwala.', 'Amin was head of the Indian Premier League for 17 months after its founder Lalit Modi was sacked in 2010. ']
person.name: Chirayu Amin
