bios: ['With fellow Ukrainian billionaire Henadiy Boholyubov, Ihor Kolomoyskyy founded PrivatBank in the early 1990s. ', "It grew to be a key bank in Ukraine, handling more than a third of private deposits and serving approximately half the country's population. ", "In 2016, Ukraine's government nationalized the bank; an investigation suggested large-scale fraud over a period of ten years. ", 'In Dec 2017, the High Court of London ordered a freeze on some $2.5 billion worth of assets held by Kolomoyskyy and Boholyubov. They deny the charges.', 'Kolomoyskyy was forced to step down as governor of the Dnipropetrovsk region in March 2015. ']
abouts: ['Kolomoyskyy holds triple Ukrainian-Israeli-Cyprus citizenship.', 'In 2016 Kolomoyskyy and Bolholyubov settled with billionaire Viktor Pinchuk, who had sued them for damages for unfulfilled pledges on mining investments.']
person.name: Ihor Kolomoyskyy

bios: ['John Goff made a fortune selling his Crescent Real Estate to Morgan Stanley for $6.5 billion in 2007, just before the financial crisis.', 'With Barclays Plc., Goff bought it back at a steep discount after the market collapse ', 'When the joint venture ended in 2017, Goff regained full control of Crescent. ', "The real estate group's most prized asset is Canyon Ranch, the legendary wellness spa and resort founded near Tuscon, Ariz. ", "Crescent's new McKinney+Olive complex, designed by Cesar Pelli, earns the highest office rents in Dallas. "]
abouts: ['Goff got his big break working for famed Fort Worth investing guru Richard Rainwater. ', 'In 2017 Goff teamed with Cowboys owner Jerry Jones to acquire pro video gaming team Complexity Gaming. ']
person.name: John Goff

bios: ["Catz became Oracle's sole CEO in September, when her co-CEO Mark Hurd stepped down a month before passing away.", 'She had served as co-CEO of software firm Oracle since September 2014, when founder Larry Ellison stepped down from the role.', 'In 2018 she made $40.7 million in compensation.', "She is credited with spearheading Oracle's aggressive acquisition strategy, helping close more than 100 acquisitions since 2005.", "A 20-year Oracle veteran, Catz is one of Ellison's closest confidants.", "Despite Catz's complaints to Trump that an RFP process favored Amazon, last fall he invited her to join a presidential intelligence advisory board."]
abouts: ["Catz served on President Donald Trump's transition team in 2016. "]
person.name: Safra Catz

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios:
['Alexander Dzhaparidze started out buying outdated seismic facilities abroad in the 1990s and offering exploration services in Russia.
', 'Dzhaparidze founded service company Petroalliance, which he later sold to Schlumberger.', "He bought oil giant Lukoil's drilling subsidiary for $130 million in 2004 and turned it into Eurasia Drilling Company.
", 'In 2017 Eurasia Drilling announced that its shareholders agreed to sell 51% of the company to Schlumberger.
']
abouts: ['Dhaparidze collects ancient daggers. \r\n', "In 2016 Dhaparidze bought a yacht, which he renamed 'Here Comes the Sun' after The Beatles song."]
person.name: Alexander Dzhaparidze

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'HONG KONG', 'ticker': '1458-HK', 'companyName': 'Zhou Hei Ya International Holdings Company', 'numberOfShares': 1391753000, 'sharePrice': 0.7135706768654225, 'currencyCode': 'HKD', 'exchangeRate': 7.7918, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Tang Jianfang is the founder and controlling shareholder of Zhou Hei Ya International Holdings, a supplier of braised duck. ', "Tang's husband Zhou Fuyu is the company chairman.", 'The two founded their business and established the first store in 2002.', 'Zhou Hei Ya listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in November 2016.']
person.name: Tang Jianfang

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Henry Davis is a third-generation beef supplier who owns $1.7 billion (annual revenues) Greater Omaha Packing.', "His beef is now eaten in 69 countries, including some of the world's top restaurants from Napa Valley's French Laundry to New York's Marea. ", 'His Greater Omaha is the fifth-largest beef producer in the U.S., after giants Tyson, Cargill, JBS and National Beef. \r\n', "Davis' grandfather started in 1920, butchering a single steer every day and selling the beef himself. Davis inherited it in 1987 and grew it 10-fold."]
abouts: ['Davis races cars on the side. He owns the first American race car to win at the legendary Le Mans course, a 1966 Ford GT40. \r\n', "The computer science major wrote Greater Omaha's first billing and operations software in 1980, which the company still uses today. \r\n"]
person.name: Henry Davis

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Michael Price runs MFP Investors, a New York-based hedge fund with over $1 billion in assets.', 'Price began his career in finance as a research assistant at Heine Securities in 1975 and bought the company after Michael Heine died in 1988. ', "Price increased the value of the firm's assets under management to $17 billion before selling it to Franklin Securities for $670 million in 1996.", 'After the sale, Price stayed on at Franklin Securities as chairman and to manage the mutual funds. He left in 2001.', 'In 1997, he donated $18 million to his alma mater, the University of Oklahoma, which renamed the business school after him.']
abouts: ['In 2001, Price donated $25 million to Yeshiva University to fund the 223,000-square-foot Michael F. Price Center for Genetic and Translational Medicine. ']
person.name: Michael Price

bios: ['Known as the "King of Diamonds," Lev Leviev owns an integrated diamond outfit with mines in places like South Africa & a jewelry boutique in New York.', 'He made his name undercutting the DeBeers diamond cartel, striking his own deals with diamond-producing countries like Russia and Angola.', 'Leviev is also the controlling shareholder of Africa Israel Investments, a real estate and construction company listed on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange.', 'Leviev was born in Uzbekistan. His Lubavitcher Jewish family fled to Israel in 1971.']
person.name: Lev Leviev

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bio:
*Hiroshi Okura started cosmetics company Noevir Holdings in 1964 and is currently chairman, while his son, Takashi is president.
*Okura says the products were inspired by a visit he made to Germany's Black Forest region.
*Noevir posted nearly $520 million in revenue in the fiscal year through September 2017.
*The company implements an Avon-like direct-selling business model, and has subsidiaries in the U.S., Canada, China and Taiwan. 
*Noevir Holdings listed on the JASDAQ market in 2004 and on the First Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange in 2012.
person.name: Hiroshi Okura & family

bios: ['Lee Myung-hee is the chairwoman of Shinsegae Group with interests in fashion, hospitality, food and beverage and other sectors.', 'She is the youngest daughter of late Samsung Group founder, Lee Byung-Chull, and a sister of Samsung chairman Lee Kun-Hee. ', 'Her Shinsegae International imports and distributes around 30 premium brands, including Alexander Wang, Brunello Cucinelli and Celine. ', "The bulk of her wealth comes from E-Mart, which went public in 2011 and is now the country's biggest discount retail chain.", "Shinsegae was part of the Samsung Group until it split off in 1991, four years after the founder's death. "]
person.name: Lee Myung-hee

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Ni Zhaoxing chairs Zhongrong International Holdings Group, a private company active in real estate, energy and art.', "Ni bought cheaply into Shanghai's Pudong district in the 1990s and built office towers there.", "He is currently focused on promoting Chang'an No. 1, which boasts 78 European-style villas in a western Beijing mountain landscape."]
person.name: Ni Zhaoxing

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Linden Blue is a vice chairman at General Atomics, a San Diego-based private company known for its Predator drones.', 'Blue and his brother Neal bought General Atomics, which pulled in $2.7 billion in sales in 2018, from Chevron in 1986 for a reported $60 million.', "The largest private government contractor in the U.S., GA's clients include foreign nations such as Italy, Spain, and the UAE.", 'Neal Blue, who is the chairman and CEO of the company, is worth $4.1 billion. ']
abouts: ['In 1956, Neal, then 21, and Linden, 20, flew across Central and South America on a plane that they piloted. Life Magazine put their excursion on its cover.', 'After graduating from Yale, the brothers both served in the U.S. Air Force (Neal Blue as a nuclear weapons custodian and Linden Blue as a security police).']
person.name: Linden Blue

person.name: Cheng Xianfeng

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Samuel Barata owns just over half of Drogarias DPSP,  one of Brazil's largest drugstore chains. ", 'The company was formed in the 2011 merger of Drogaria Pacheco, owned by Barata, and Drogaria Sao Paulo, owned the Carvalho family.', 'The company had 2017 revenues of about $2.4 billion, and has more than 1,000 stores in 10 Brazilian states. ', "One of Brazil's oldest companies, Drogaria Pacheco was founded in 1892 and acquired by Barata in the 1970s."]
person.name: Samuel Barata

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Ludwig Theodor Braun owns 10% of the medical device company B. Braun Melsungen, which began in 1839 as a small pharmacy that sold herbal remedies.', 'His father, Ludwig Georg Braun, took the reins in 1977, when the company had just $24 million in annual sales (now around $8 billion).', 'Today, with 60,000 employees globally, B. Braun manufactures products ranging from infusion and injection solutions to surgical instruments.']
abouts: ['A sixth-generation family member, Ludwig Theodor is the youngest son of Ludwig Georg.', 'B. Braun has been operating in Africa for more than 60 years, and now has subsidiaries in Zambia, Algeria, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.']
person.name: Ludwig Theodor Braun

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Yongli chairs Yongli Group, a business with interests in trading, real estate and finance.', 'Yongli, headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Shaoxing in Zhejiang Province, was established in December 1986.']
person.name: Zhou Yongli & family

bios: ['Robert Toll is chairman on the board of Toll Brothers, a publicly-traded luxury homebuilder.', "He cofounded the firm with his younger brother Bruce in 1967. The company's first project was a new community of 171 homes in Chester County, PA.", ' Robert served as CEO of Toll Brothers until 2010; he is the largest individual shareholder in the company, with a 7% stake.', 'Though the company is based in Pennsylvania, the brothers live in Miami with their children (Robert has five kids, Bruce has four) and grandchildren.']
abouts: [' At 18, Toll was a counselor at Camp Powhatan in Maine. The organization is now known as Seeds of Peace, and brings Arabs and Israelis together for summer sessions.', "Robert's father was a multimillionaire investor who lost it all in the 1929 stock market crash. To support his family through the Depression he delivered laundry. "]
person.name: Robert Toll

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Sanford "Sandy" Weill spent decades in financial services, culminating with Travelers and Citicorp merging to form Citigroup in 1998.', "Weill's first job was a Bear Stearns runner in 1955, earning $150 a week. ", 'He formed a brokerage firm with partners, built it into Shearson Loeb Rhoads, and sold it to American Express for nearly $1 billion in 1981. ', 'Weill was CEO of Citigroup until 2003 and chairman until 2006.', ' He is still an active investor, president of the board of trustees at Carnegie Hall and on the executive council at UC San Francisco. ']
abouts: ['When Weill first got married, he and his wife lived with her parents.', "Weill's protege at Travelers and Citigroup was Jamie Dimon, who left in 2000 to be CEO of Bank One (now JP Morgan Chase). \r\n"]
person.name: Sandy Weill

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios:
['On the Run II, his stadium tour with wife Beyonc, grossed roughly $5 million per night, pulling in a total of more than $250 million.', "Here's to Jay-Z! The superstar mints millions annually from his Armand de Brignac champagne and D'Uss cognac, a joint venture with Bacardi.", "He became hip-hop's first billionaire this spring thanks to an empire encompassing liquor, art, real estate and stakes in companies like Uber.
"]
person.name: Jay-Z

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Tharaldson purchased his first Super 8 motel in 1982 in Valley City, N.D.', 'From there he built his fortune by acquiring and building hotels across the country, eventually accumulating a portfolio of about 350 properties.', 'In 2006, he sold 130 hotels to Goldman Sachs for about $1.2 billion, which he reinvested into land and commercial and residential developments. ', 'In 2008, he launched an ethanol facility near Fargo, N.D., which produces 153 million gallons per year.']
abouts: ['Tharaldson once worked as a physical education teacher and insurance salesman. ', "He's the richest person in North Dakota. "]
person.name: Gary Tharaldson

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Brian Armstrong is the chief executive of Coinbase, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the U.S.\r\n\r\n', 'Armstrong co-founded Coinbase, which is based in San Francisco, in 2012. ', 'Coinbase raised $300 million in October 2018 in a financing round led by Tiger Global that valued the company at $8 billion. ']
person.name: Brian Armstrong

bios: ['Hary Tanoesoedibjo got his start building a media business soon after college; he still owns more than 60 TV stations, radio stations and a newspaper.', 'He stepped down as CEO of his Media Nusantara Citra (MNC), which owns 4 national TV stations, in 2016 to focus on politics.', "Via his listed firm MNC Land, he is building resorts in Bali and West Java that will be managed by Donald Trump's company. "]
abouts: ["Hary, who attended Donald Trump's inauguration, is building a six-star luxury Trump Hotel resort in Bali.", 'Hary is now actively involved in his political party Perindo, which he founded in 2014 after a brief run as VP.']
person.name: Hary Tanoesoedibjo

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Adam Neumann is a cofounder of coworking firm WeWork; he resigned as CEO in September 2019 shortly before the company cancelled a planned IPO.', "A month later, longtime investor SoftBank stepped in with a deal to buy $3 billion of WeWork's existing shares and loan the company $5 billion.", 'The deal valued the troubled startup at $8 billion; it was last valued at $47 billion in a January 2019 fundraising round. ', 'WeWork is reportedly selling assets, including a $60 million private plane.', 'The company rents out office space in more than 110 cities around the world and features arcade rooms and on-site beer kegs. ']
abouts: ['Before WeWork Neumann ran a business that made baby overalls with built-in knee pads. ', 'Neumann was raised on a kibbutz in Israel and moved to New York City in 2001 following his sister, a Miss Teen Israel, as she pursued a modeling career.']
person.name: Adam Neumann

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Lowell Milken is the younger brother and the former right-hand man of former financier Michael Milken.', 'Mike Milken expanded the market for high-yield junk bonds while at investment bank Drexel Burnham Lambert in the 1980s. \r\n', 'Lowell is the chairman and partial owner of Heron International, a London-based real estate firm that develops, invests in and manages properties.', 'He cofounded education firm Knowledge Universe in the mid 1990s.', 'In 2015, Knowledge Universe sold its early childhood education business to private equity firm Partners Group for an undisclosed sum.\r\n']
person.name: Lowell Milken

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Yoshikazu Tanaka's company Gree develops free-to-play mobile and social-network-based games. ", 'He founded the company in 2004 and took it public in 2008.', "Tanaka, the company's president and chairman, owns a 46% stake."]
person.name: Yoshikazu Tanaka

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Boris Zingarevich and his business partner Zakhar Smuskhin got involved in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', "Later that decade, during the country's privatization phase, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.", "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million, most of which was cash.', 'Zingarevich also controls Ilim Timber, a large Russian processed timber firm.']
person.name: Boris Zingarevich

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Zakhar Smuskhin and his business partner Boris Zingarevich were active in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', 'Later in the 1990s, during the privatization phase in Russia, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.', "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million.', 'Smushkin also owns about 9,900 acres of land near Saint Petersburg.']
abouts: [" Russia's prime minister and former president, Dmitry Medvedev, worked as general counsel of Ilim Holding in the mid 1990s.", 'Smuskhin collects Russian paintings, particularly works by Mikhail Vrubel.']
person.name: Zakhar Smushkin

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Saeed Bin Butti Al Qebaisi is chairman of Centurion Investments, an Abu Dhabi firm with investments in healthcare, financial services and retail.', "Al Qebaisi's most valuable stake is in NMC Health, a London-listed firm that bills itself as the largest private healthcare provider in the U.A.E. ", 'NMC  Healthcare, which runs hospitals and clinics in a dozen countries, was founded by fellow billionaire B.R. Shetty.', 'He has investment partnerships with Khalifa Bin Butti Al Muhairi, also a billionaire, that include stakes in Finablr, a financial services firm.']
abouts: ['Bin Butti Al Qebaisi comes from a prominent Emirati family that is related by marriage to the royal family of Abu Dhabi. ']

bios: ['Lim and his family own a majority stake in Singapore-listed palm oil producer Bumitama Agri; its plantations are located in Indonesia.', 'His son Lim Gunawan Hariyanto is chairman and CEO of Bumitama Agri.', "The family's Harita Group also owns the majority of listed bauxite mining firm Cita Mineral Investindo.", "Lim's father emigrated from China to East Kalimantan and reportedly opened a grocery store in 1915.", 'Daughter Christina is president commissioner of securities firm Harita Kencana Securitas.']
person.name: Lim Hariyanto Wijaya Sarwono

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Former Amazon executive, Binny Bansal, teamed up with pal Sachin Bansal in 2007 to found Flipkart as an online seller of books.', 'The duo, who share the same surname but are not related, pooled $6,000 of their combined savings and started operating out of their apartment. \r\n', "In 2018, Wal-Mart bought a 77% stake in Flipkart for $16 billion in what was the world's biggest deal for an internet firm. ", 'Bansal, who retains a 4% stake in the firm and had orchestrated the Wal-Mart deal, initially stayed on as chairman and group chief executive.', 'He resigned in November 2018, when he was accused of serious personal misconduct. He denied the allegation but admitted to lapses in judgement.']
person.name: Binny Bansal

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Folorunsho Alakija is vice chair of Famfa Oil, a Nigerian oil exploration company with a stake in Agbami Oilfield, a prolific offshore asset.', "Famfa Oil's partners include Chevron and Petrobras. ", "Alakija's first company was a fashion label whose customers included the wife of former Nigerian president Ibrahim Babangida.", "The Nigerian government awarded Alakija's company an oil prospecting license in 1993, which was later converted to an oil mining lease. ", 'The Agbami field has been operating since 2008; Famfa Oil says it will likely operate through 2024. ']
person.name: Folorunsho Alakija

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Fatma Tuba Yazici and her three sons became the largest shareholders in Diler Holding when her husband, Recep Sami Yazici, died suddenly in 2009.', "She's CEO of Diler and Yazici Iron and Steel, among Turkey's largest iron and steel producers, and owns shares of publicly traded Asil Steel Company.", 'She lives in Beylerbeyi, one of the most beautiful areas of the Bosporus in Istanbul.', "She's a member of the professional committee council for Iron Steel and Hot Mill Products Industry at the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce."]
abouts: ["Fatma Tuba Yazici is Turkey's only woman billionaire industrialist.", "She doesn't grant interviews or provide photographs to the media, because she doesn't want to be recognized on the street."]
person.name: Fatma Tuba Yazici

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Jin Huiming chairs Shanghai-based Dahua Group, one of China's 50 largest developers.", "Dahua's predecessor company was a collective."]
person.name: Jin Huiming

bios: ["Albert Yeung branched out from his father's watch shop to found leading Hong Kong retailer Emperor Watch & Jewellery. ", 'Emperor Group includes five listed Hong Kong companies.', 'The group concedes that its entertainment interests, notably Cantopop and film production, are more about publicity for the brand than for revenue.', "Emperor's real estate holdings focus on Hong Kong, Beijing and London."]
abouts: ['Yeung holds no corporate office in Emperor Group companies but is the controlling shareholder. ', 'Yeung counts actor Jackie Chan as a friend and investor.', 'Emperor Hotel in Macau features red-coated faux Coldstream Guards outside and, inside, real gold bars embedded in the lobby floor. ']
person.name: Albert Yeung

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['At 21, celebrity-turned-makeup mogul Kylie Jenner is the youngest self-made billionaire ever.', 'Jenner, who started out peddling $29 lip kits in 2015, sold an estimated $360 million worth of Kylie Cosmetics in 2018.', 'In November 2018, Jenner launched a distribution deal with beauty retailer Ulta and sold an estimated $55 million of product in just 6 weeks.', 'In May 2019 she announced the launch of her vegan Kylie Skin line. She recently filed a trademark for a possible baby line. ', 'Thanks to its super low overhead and massive sales, the company is worth at least $900 million. Jenner owns a 100% stake.', 'Jenner used $250,000 of her earnings from modeling gigs to pay an outside company to produce her first 15,000 lip kits.']
abouts: ['Jenner has 177 million social media followers.', 'At age 17, two years before starting the business, Jenner trademarked the phrase "Kylie Lip Kits ... For the perfect pout."', "Her family's reality TV show, Keeping up with the Kardashians, premiered when she was just 10 years old.", 'Her sister is model Kendall Jenner and her half-sister is Kim Kardashian West. ']
person.name: Kylie Jenner

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Ajay Kalsi is the chairman of London-listed Indus Gas, which owns natural gas blocks in Rajasthan in western India.', 'The company is planning an $85 million expansion to appraise and develop existing wells. ', "Kalsi's other interests span real estate, outsourcing and footwear. "]
abouts: ["He started out in the family's shoe business making sneakers for Reebok and still has a small stake in Reebok India.", 'He studied at the London School of Economics and Cambridge University.']
person.name: Ajay Kalsi

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Alexander Samwer and his brothers Oliver and Marc founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'The youngest of the brothers, Alexander does not take part in day-to-day management of the company, leaving that to Oliver.', 'Together, the brothers own around 40% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, the brothers created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million.']
abouts: ['Alexander is on the board of directors of Zalando, a German e-commerce company founded by Rocket Internet and modeled after Zappos in the U.S.', 'He graduated from Oxford University and from Harvard University with an MBA.']
person.name: Alexander Samwer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Marc Samwer and his brothers Alexander and Oliver founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'Together, they own around 40% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, the Samwers created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months.', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million. ']
abouts: ['Marc studied law at the University of Cologne.']
person.name: Marc Samwer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Oliver Samwer and his brothers Alexander and Marc founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'Often characterized as ruthless and pugnacious, Oliver is the middle brother and CEO.', 'Together, the Samwers own around 40% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, they created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months.', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million. ']
abouts: ['Oliver Samwer has been known to say that he\'ll do "whatever it takes" to win.']
person.name: Oliver Samwer

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Marek Dospiva is cofounder of Penta Investments, which has investments in the healthcare, banking, real estate and aeronautical industries. ', 'Penta has controlling stakes in Privatbanka, pharmacy chain Dr. Max and sports betting operator Fortuna.  ', 'Dospiva and Slovak Jaroslav Hascak, who were both studying in Beijing, got started importing Chinese textiles to chain stores in Czechoslovakia.', "During Slovakia's 1996 privatization, Penta gained control over the nation's biggest fund paying only 20 percent of its real market value. ", 'Dospiva and Hascak are still both partners and the largest shareholders of Penta Investments. ']
abouts: ['Dospiva is developing an office building complex in Prague that was the last project of famous British architect Zaha Hadid, who died in 2016.', 'Dospiva, who speaks Chinese and likes sports car, is co-owner of Ferrari and Maserati dealerships in the Czech Republic. ']
person.name: Marek Dospiva

name: Real-Time Billionaires
financialAssets: [{'exchange': 'HO CHI MINH CITY', 'ticker': 'MSN-VN', 'companyName': 'Masan Group', 'numberOfShares': 299456000, 'sharePrice': 2.438234976804402, 'currencyCode': 'VND', 'exchangeRate': 23172.5, 'interactive': False}, {'exchange': 'HO CHI MINH CITY', 'ticker': 'TCB-VN', 'companyName': 'Vietnam Technological and Commercial Joint Stock Bank', 'numberOfShares': 266370000, 'sharePrice': 1.016290862013162, 'currencyCode': 'VND', 'exchangeRate': 23172.5, 'interactive': False}]
bios: ['Nguyen Dang Quang belongs to the wave of Vietnamese students who studied in Russia and Eastern Europe in the 1980s, after the Vietnam War. ', "He returned to Vietnam and worked for Vietnam's Academy of Sciences before joining the private sector in the 1990s. ", 'He invested in commercial bank Techcombank in 1993 and later founded Masan Group with business partner, Ho Hung Anh, in 2004.', 'While Ho Hung Anh, who is chairman of Techcombank, is in charge of the bank, Nguyen focused on building Masan Group. Nguyen is now chairman of Masan Group.', 'Masan Group has interests in a wide range of consumer and food product businesses, ranging from animal feeds to food processing.']
person.name: Nguyen Dang Quang

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["The most important source of Mehmet Nazif Gunal's wealth are 10 five-star hotels concentrated in Turkey's most important tourism regions.", 'He received a civil engineering degree in 1971 and established his own construction firm, eventually taking on projects throughout the Middle East.', 'Under wholly owned MNG Holding, he expanded into hotel investments and management, transportation, mining and energy production and marketing.', "Gunal's Avesoro Holdings mines gold in Africa, with two operations in Liberia and one in Burkina Faso."]
abouts: ['Operating under the World of Wonders brand name, his Kremlin Palace and Topkapi Palace hotels in Antalya are architecturally exact replicas of their namesakes.', 'MNG is one of five main contractors working on the new Istanbul Airport, which will have an annual passenger capacity of 200 million when all phases are complete.']
person.name: Mehmet Nazif Gunal

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate billionaire Axel Stawski founded Stawski Partners in 1973. ', 'The company owns six office buildings and three condos in Manhattan.', "He is developing two luxury residential towers in Queens' Long Island City, his first developments in about a decade.", 'Stawski was born in post-war Germany to Jewish parents who both survived the Holocaust.', 'He immigrated to the U.S. in 1971 to attend New York University.']
abouts: ['Stawski is a board member of the American Society for Yad Vashem, which supports the Yad Vashem World Holocaust Remembrance Center in Jerusalem.', "Before emigrating to the U.S. with his family in 1971, Stawski's father was a real estate developer in West Germany, focusing on shopping centers."]
person.name: Axel Stawski

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Bent Jensen is the owner and CEO of Linak, a $600 million (sales) Danish company that manufactures and sells linear actuators.', 'Linear actuators are devices that convert power into linear motion and are used in industrial equipment, furniture and hospital beds.', "Jensen's grandfather founded the company in 1907; it originally made pulleys, grinding mills and forges.", 'Jensen, who received a mechanical engineering degree, joined the firm in 1976 -- with an idea for a new product: the linear actuator.', 'Today the company has factories in Denmark, the U.S., China and Slovakia.']
abouts: ['Jensen came up with the idea for linear actuators while talking with a friend from school, who had a disability, about ways to improve his wheelchair.']
person.name: Bent Jensen

bios: ["Lee Hwa-kyung is the vice chairwoman of Orion, one of the country's oldest and most popular confectionery groups. ", 'In 2017 she was indicted of embezzling $356,000 through moving company-owned artworks to her home; critics say the blame has shifted from her husband.', 'Her husband, Dam Chul-gon, who chairs the group, was acquitted of charges of embezzlement and tax evasion in an ongoing case that started in 2011. ', "The second daughter of Lee Yang-koo, founder of Dongyang (precursor to the group), Lee also runs Orion's entertainment business Showbox. ", 'Lee holds nearly a 33% stake in Orion Holdings, while her husband owns 29%.']
abouts: ["The company's most famous product is Choco Pie, which consists of a combination of biscuit, chocolate and marshmallow filling."]
person.name: Lee Hwa-kyung

name: Real-Time Billionaires

bios: ['Mitchell Jacobson began working for MSC Direct, an office and industrial equipment distributor founded by his father Sidney, in 1976.', ' In 1995, Jacobson took over as CEO of the Melville, N.Y.-based firm, which now distributes hundreds of products, from staplers to air conditioners.', 'Jacobson held the CEO position through 2005 and, since 2013, the non-executive chairman. With nearly 15% ownership, he is the largest shareholder.']
abouts: ["Jacobson's parents, who married six weeks after they met, poisoned themselves in 2005 after Sid was diagnosed with cancer. They had been married 59 years.", 'Mitchell has one sister, Marjorie Gershwind Fiverson, whose son Erik is currently the President and Chief executive at the company.']
person.name: Mitchell Jacobson

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["Hiroshi Ishibashi is a grandson of the founder of Bridgestone, the world's largest tire maker.", 'He owns less than 3% of the Tokyo-listed company.', "Hiroshi heads the Ishibashi Foundation, which operates Tokyo's Bridgestone Museum of Art."]
person.name: Hiroshi Ishibashi

name: Real-Time Billionaires

bios: ["Ricardo Po founded Century Pacific, the Philippines' leading exporter of private-label tuna products, in 1978.", 'Po, whose early business was advertising firm Cathay Promotions, lost most of his fortune in the 1973 stock market crash. ', 'Through his Arthaland, Po also has interests in property development.', "Century Pacific has a major stake in fast food chain Shakey's Pizza, which went public in December 2016.", "His son Christopher is Century's executive chairman; another son, Teodoro, is president and CEO."]
person.name: Ricardo Po Sr & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Alexander Vik comes from a wealthy family of fur merchants and has dabbled in everything from closed-end country funds to insurance and tech startups.', 'He remains locked in a contentious legal battle with Deutsche Bank, which in late 2013 obtained a $250 million judgment against his trading operation.', "Deutsche had sued the trading operation, based largely out of Vik's Connecticut home, over a margin call that went unpaid during the financial crisis.", "So far Vik is not paying and has appealed the London court's judgment.", "Meanwhile Deutsche has started legal proceedings in New York, Connecticut, Delaware and Oslo to investigate Vik's assets."]
abouts: ['A Norwegian who was raised in Sweden and schooled in the Canary Islands, Vik was a former golf champion at Harvard University.', 'During the first Internet bubble, Vik was behind Xcelera.com, one of the biggest dot.com boom and bust stocks of the era.']
person.name: Alexander Vik

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['A co-founder of private equity firm Thoma Bravo, Carl Thoma is one of the deans of the buyout business.', "A graduate of Oklahoma State University and the Stanford's business school, Thoma cofounded GTCR in 1980 and then split from the firm in 1998.", "Created Thoma Cressey in 1998 and hired a young dealmaker, Orlando Bravo, who would go on to build the firm's software strategy.", 'Thoma and Bravo split from Cressey in 2008. Since, software-focused Thoma Bravo has posted top returns and grown to $39 billion in assets.', "Thoma's family foundation is a major patron of the arts. A recent initiative is to provide free admission to the Museum of Contemporary Art in Cleveland."]
abouts: ["Carl and Marilynn Thoma met at Oklahoma State. They are avid collectors of art and wine aficionados, operating a vineyard in Oregon's Willamette Valley."]
person.name: Carl Thoma

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["David Hall is at the forefront of the self-driving car revolution with his LiDAR sensors that allow vehicles to see what's around them.", 'He first patented a LiDAR sensor in 2006 as part of a race for autonomous vehicles sponsored by the U.S. Department of Defense.', 'Hall, an engineer, founded Velodyne in 1983 as an audio equipment company, selling speakers with a patented sub-woofer starting at $2,000.']
abouts: ['Hall made a robot for a TV show called "Robot Wars" that finished second-place in the 2001 world championship.', "Hall's father was also an engineer and his grandfather was a physicist."]
person.name: David Hall

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['David Kabiller is cofounder of AQR, a money management firm that trades assets through a systematic, research-driven approach.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $200 billion of assets under management.', 'Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, AQR operates globally with 1,000 employees working in offices from London to Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before AQR, he was a vice president at Goldman Sachs, working with chief investment officers of large pension and endowment funds in North America.']
abouts: ['Kabiller founded the Kabiller Prize and the Kabiller Young Investigator Award for researchers in nanoscience and nanomedicine at Northwestern University.']
person.name: David Kabiller

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Du Sha is the chairman of Pacific Links International, a global golf club membership group. ', 'Du founded the HomeWorld Group in 1992, and built the company into two major retail chains with 97 superstores before selling them off.', 'Son Jeff runs a successful investment company in Beijing.']
person.name: Du Sha

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ["GT Dave started brewing kombucha in his parents' Bel Air kitchen at 16 years old in 1995. ", "He became the first to commercialize the fizzy drink, pioneering what's now one of the hottest categories in beverage. ", "Today, GT's Kombucha controls around 40% of the U.S. kombucha market, generating an estimated $275 million in annual sales. ", 'Unlike his investor-backed competitors today, Dave still owns 100% of his company and has diversified into other drinks like CBD water.']
abouts: ['Dave never went to college and left high school early with a GED, after falling in with a crowd of rich kids with a taste for drugs. ', 'Kombucha, an ancient fermented tea used by travelers along the Silk Road, earned a following during the AIDS epidemic as a supposed immune-booster.']
person.name: GT Dave

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['John Liew is co-founder of AQR, a money management firm that trades through a systematic, data-driven approach.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $200 billion of assets under management.', 'Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, AQR operates globally with 1,000 employees working in offices from London to Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before cofounding AQR, Liew worked at Goldman Sachs as a portfolio manager, where he developed and managed quantitative trading strategies.', "He created the Liew College Fellows Fund to finance undergraduates who have unpaid research opportunities with the University of Chicago's faculty."]
person.name: John Liew

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Morris Kahn cofounded Amdocs, a customer-relationship management-and-billing software firm for large telecom outfits. ', 'He sold nearly $1 billion worth of shares after Admocs went public in 1998.', 'A South African native, he lives on the Israeli coast and spends most of his time on a 100-foot yacht.', 'Through his Aurum Ventures, Morris invests in life sciences and clean-tech companies that he hopes will contribute to the wellbeing of the planet.', 'He cofounded Coral World International, which had built aquariums in locations such as the Bahamas and Australia. ']
abouts: ['An avid diver, Kahn started building aquariums after a diving accident that gave him a burst eardrum, forcing him to stay on land for months. ']
person.name: Morris Kahn

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Former Amazon executive, Sachin Bansal, teamed up with pal Binny Bansal, also a billionaire, in 2007 to found Flipkart as an online seller of books. ', 'The duo, who share the same surname but are not related, pooled $6,000 of their combined savings and started operating out of their apartment. ', "In 2018, Wal-Mart bought a 77% stake in Flipkart for $16 billion in what was the world's biggest deal for an internet firm. ", 'Bansal cashed out, selling his minority stake for $1 billion.']
abouts: ['Bansal is an online gaming enthusiast.', 'In January 2019, Bansal picked up a minority stake in ride-hailing firm Ola for $100 million.']
person.name: Sachin Bansal

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Tatyana Bakalchuk, a former English teacher and mother of four, founded e-commerce retailer Wildberries in 2004.', 'She founded the business at age 28 in her Moscow apartment while on maternity leave.', 'Her husband, Vladislav, an IT technician, soon joined her. ', 'In the early years, she resold clothes from German retailer Otto.', 'Wildberries, which offers 15,000 brands on its website, sold over $1.9 billion worth of apparel in 2018.  \r\n']
abouts: ['Wildberries processes roughly 400,000 orders a day.', 'Bakalchuk is only the second woman from Russia to appear in Forbes Billionaire Ranks.']
person.name: Tatyana Bakalchuk

person.name: Zhang Zhongneng & family

name: Real-Time Billionaires
bios: ['Miguel McKelvey cofounded communal office rental firm WeWork (now known as The We Company) with Adam Neumann in 2010.', 'McKelvey serves as Chief Culture Officer of the company, which cancelled a planned IPO in September 2019.', 'McKelvey became a billionaire in 2016; as of November 2019 Forbes estimates his net worth at $900 million.', 'We Co. raised about $10 billion from investors including Softbank, Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan Chase.', "The company leases office space and then rents it out in more than 110 cities; it's working to sell assets to preserve cash. "]
abouts: ['McKelvey was raised in a five-mother commune in Eugene, Ore.', 'Though he rarely got on the court, McKelvey played on the basketball team at the University of Oregon for two years. ']
person.name: Miguel McKelvey
